content.rendered:
Good morning,

Romans 8:28, “And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are called according to His purpose”

I’m honored and humbled to be used of God to reach many. Many years ago I would have never imagined what God would plant in my life as His servant weaknesses and faults. When I tell people I used to be shy and intimidated, it blows their mind and they find it hard to believe that was me. I remember even joking about it and telling my family that the day they will put me in front of a congregation just to say my name, they better have an ambulance outside to drive me to the hospital for I knew for sure I would pass out. After many years of looking at myself that way, God began to give me confidence by looking at other people who were moving forward and I told the Lord that if they can, I too can, Not because I was jealous of them but because I believed there was more do too for the Lord.

From experience, few people can move forward by themselves without the inspiration of others. Over the years I have learnt to encourage myself and then there are things and people around me who will provoke and challenge my current position and it’s upon me to decide whether I want to remain where I am or challenge myself to move to the next level. As long as there is nothing to challenge or provoke you, you will feel that you have arrived but the moment something begins to come your way as a reminder that where you are could be a stepping stone, you will purpose in your heart to think twice. Pastor Phil challenges me in the area of witnessing, the Word and discipleship. I have grown more in these areas through his lifestyle, I challenge him in prayers and encouragements because I find myself stronger in these areas.

In the book of 1Samuel 1:1-28 is an interesting story. We are told of three people, Elkanah, Penninah and Hannah. Elkanah is the husband to both Penninah and Hannah, Elkanah loved Hannah more than Penninah as the bible says. and Elkanah always gave bigger portion of gifts that he had to Hannah and less to Penninah. Penninah on the other hand was blessed with children because God opened her womb. Hannah’s womb was shut. In the Old testament having children especially boys was a sign of a blessing, a man was considered blessed if his wife could give him boys. Well we see how Elkanah loved Hannah more than Penninah and yet Hannah had no children. If you remember, Jacob loved Rachel more than Leah and yet Leah had many children while Rachel did not until at a later time.

One thing about the story of Hannah that fascinates me is that she was okay until Penninah had children and she desired her own, to make matters worse in 1samuel 1 vs. 6 “… her rival (Penninah) also provoked her severely, to make her miserable”. Yes Hannah was loved more than Penninah, and yes she received more gifts than her but yet she realized there was more she could have desired. Her desire was not to compete against her rival or get even, her desire was to gain more from the Lord. God had allowed Penninah to provoke her as Leah was allowed to provoke Rachel. She decides to go to pray to God, a prayer of desperation, praying earnestly and constantly the only thing that made her prayers to be answered is when she vowed that the child God would give her, she would dedicate him back to God serving Him all the days of his life. Samuel is born, became a prophet and what a mighty man he was. Also, Rachel bore Joseph who later became the number two man in Egypt and through his life, Israel was saved from a severe draught.

Suppose there was nothing to challenge and provoke these women to move to the next level, what an opportunity many would have missed. “All things work together” whether it be frustrations, someone provoking you, or through what you see and get challenged by. I would pray that we will evaluate and examine the reason why we would desire more than what we have.

I thank God for this far He has brought me but with the new things that are provoking and challenging me, I am going after them. No need to be frustrated when people are provoking and challenging you, they are doing you a favor and I would say those are loyal friends. Judas betrayed Jesus, but it worked for our good as God’s pre arranged plan for our salvation.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Romans 8:28, “And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are called according to His purpose”

I’m honored and humbled to be used of God to reach many. Many years ago I would have never imagined what God would plant in my life as His servant weaknesses and faults. When I tell people I used to be shy and intimidated, it blows their mind and they find it hard to believe that was me. I remember even joking about it and telling my family that the day they will put me in front of a congregation just to say my name, they better have an ambulance outside to drive me to the hospital for I knew for sure I would pass out. After many years of looking at myself that way, God began to give me confidence by looking at other people who were moving forward and I told the Lord that if they can, I too can, Not because I was jealous of them but because I believed there was more do too for the Lord.

From experience, few people can move forward by themselves without the inspiration of others. Over the years I have learnt to encourage myself and then there are things and people around me who will provoke and challenge my current position and it’s upon me to decide whether I want to remain where I am or challenge myself to move to the next level. As long as there is nothing to challenge or provoke you, you will feel that you have arrived but the moment something begins to come your way as a reminder that where you are could be a stepping stone, you will purpose in your heart to think twice. Pastor Phil challenges me in the area of witnessing, the Word and discipleship. I have grown more in these areas through his lifestyle, I challenge him in prayers and encouragements because I find myself stronger in these areas.

In the book of 1Samuel 1:1-28 is an interesting story. We are told of three people, Elkanah, Penninah and Hannah. Elkanah is the husband to both Penninah and Hannah, Elkanah loved Hannah more than Penninah as the bible says. and Elkanah always gave bigger portion of gifts that he had to Hannah and less to Penninah. Penninah on the other hand was blessed with children because God opened her womb. Hannah’s womb was shut. In the Old testament having children especially boys was a sign of a blessing, a man was considered blessed if his wife could give him boys. Well we see how Elkanah loved Hannah more than Penninah and yet Hannah had no children. If you remember, Jacob loved Rachel more than Leah and yet Leah had many children while Rachel did not until at a later time.

One thing about the story of Hannah that fascinates me is that she was okay until Penninah had children and she desired her own, to make matters worse in 1samuel 1 vs. 6 “… her rival (Penninah) also provoked her severely, to make her miserable”. Yes Hannah was loved more than Penninah, and yes she received more gifts than her but yet she realized there was more she could have desired. Her desire was not to compete against her rival or get even, her desire was to gain more from the Lord. God had allowed Penninah to provoke her as Leah was allowed to provoke Rachel. She decides to go to pray to God, a prayer of desperation, praying earnestly and constantly the only thing that made her prayers to be answered is when she vowed that the child God would give her, she would dedicate him back to God serving Him all the days of his life. Samuel is born, became a prophet and what a mighty man he was. Also, Rachel bore Joseph who later became the number two man in Egypt and through his life, Israel was saved from a severe draught.

Suppose there was nothing to challenge and provoke these women to move to the next level, what an opportunity many would have missed. “All things work together” whether it be frustrations, someone provoking you, or through what you see and get challenged by. I would pray that we will evaluate and examine the reason why we would desire more than what we have.

I thank God for this far He has brought me but with the new things that are provoking and challenging me, I am going after them. No need to be frustrated when people are provoking and challenging you, they are doing you a favor and I would say those are loyal friends. Judas betrayed Jesus, but it worked for our good as God’s pre arranged plan for our salvation.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 15:1&2, “1 “I am the true vine, and My Father is the vinedresser. 2 Every branch in Me that does not bear fruit He takes away; and every branch that bears fruit He prunes, that it may bear more fruit”

We all have goals and time frames to accomplish them. If you have goals, you work hard to achieve them and many times within the time frame you have allocated those goals. Often times you find that in pursuit of your goal, there are some things that occur that creates a setback or a delay in what you are working hard towards. The setbacks can be painful and costly but they are there and have to be dealt with. Setbacks will not push you forward but backwards if not stagnant and this could take days, weeks, months and even years. Do we ever sit and wonder why at times we have setbacks in our lives?

John 15 is a good chapter that paints the picture of how setbacks work. Jesus likened Himself to a True vine and the Father as the vinedresser. As believers we are connected to the True vine as branches and the branches have significant roles of bearing fruit. Jesus says, “Every branch in Me that does not bear fruit He takes away“. Note how He puts it, “every branch IN ME”, in other words, every believer connected to Him should bear fruit and there has to be things within that believer that allows them to stay connected and be fresh to bear fruit. The branches that do not bear fruit are dead branches He takes away because they do not belong to Him. No one can take them away but Him. It is my hope that we do not fall into this category.

“and every branch that bears fruit He prunes, that it may bear more fruit“. This is where many of us are, it’s not that the branch is not bearing fruit, the reason for the setback. And it’s not always sin that sets us back, at times it’s because God wants us to bear more fruit. So He may take away a good thing that is happening in your life and of course that would create a setback but He knows what He is doing. We know the devil loves to whisper in our ears the reason we are going through what we are facing is because we messed up. When David was anointed to be king, for the next 17 years he was running for his life not because he sinned but because He was being pruned to bear more fruit and so was Job, Daniel and many others in the bible. It was not even to teach them a lesson, it was to get them to bear more fruit. The pruning the Lord does is to allow His children to grow and be stronger. You may have seen yourself being married by now and nothing has happened and you wonder whether you sinned or missed God’s will or you are being taught a lesson and the like. The blessing may be delayed but not denied. It could be the Lord wants to develop more of the fruit of patience, faith, self-control among others. You may have worked hard to get a job and you did but then you lost it and it created a setback, you never know, maybe the Lord is developing in you character and integrity that will sustain you when he opens the door. You may have desired to be in ministry and nothing has happened yet, could be the Lord is teaching you leadership, submission, humility and more. I’m not saying you may have not had them, he says “that it may bear more fruit“, He wants to get more of it out of you. This could also be the grounds of testimonies that despite all that has happened, God knew what He was doing and in His right time, He made all things beautiful.

You and I can look at the setbacks as TEMPORARY situations that delay what we want to achieve. It’s upon us to look at them as some things the Lord could be using to get more fruit out of us. We can also look at them as a means of growth. Instead of crying to the Lord asking why we have them, we can pray Lord what can I learn from this. Over the years I have seen setbacks in my life help me grow and I thank God for them. My wife and I have some setbacks right now but we choose to see them as a means of growth. If you want to bear more fruit, expect setbacks (Pruning).

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Why should the wedding ring be worn on the fourth finger?

content.rendered:
Why should the wedding ring be worn on the fourth finger?

There is a beautiful and convincing explanation…..

 

Thumb represents your Parents
Second (Index) finger represents your Siblings
Middle finger represents your-Self
Fourth (Ring) finger represents your Life Partner
& the Last (Little) finger represents your children

Firstly, open your palms (face to face), bend the middle fingers and hold them together – back to back
Secondly, open and hold the remaining three fingers and the thumb – tip to tip
(As shown in the figure below):

 

Now, try to separate your thumbs (representing the parents)…, they will open, because your parents are not destined to live with you lifelong, and have to leave you sooner or later.

Please join your thumbs as before and separate your Index fingers (representing siblings)…., they will also open, because your brothers and sisters will have their own families and will have to lead their own separate lives.  

 

Now join the Index fingers and separate your Little fingers (representing your children)…., they will open too, because the children also will get married and settle down on their own some day.

 

Finally, join your Little fingers, and try to separate your Ring fingers (representing your spouse).
You will be surprised to see that you just CANNOT….., because Husband & Wife have to remain together all their lives – through thick and thin!!  

 

Try this out……..

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mathew 21:13-17, “And He said to them, “It is written, “My house shall be called a house of prayer“

Due to a lot of commitments yesterday, I was unable to deliver the devo, be blessed this morning.

Today I would like to share on three things that have allowed me to pray effectively. I pray that this will word will revolutionize you prayer life.

For things to move, change and function, they need some kind of energy or force. The cars need the motor and battery for it to function, the light need the power to make it shine, the pcs need the software for them to function. You and I realize that some things don’t move or change until some force or energy is applied to them. This goes well with our spiritual life, there is absolutely nothing that will cause us to change or move until some force or energy is ignited in our system to cause us to desire change, move and operate effectively. How will you have it if you don’t feel that you need it? and how will you need it without knowing it’s effectiveness?

Jesus is making a triumphant entry into Jerusalem, He is riding on a donkey and people are crying out hosanna, hosanna in the Highest, blessed is He that comes in the name of the Lord. He is heading towards the temple. If I had time, I would talk about what the donkey represents, people bowing, placing their garments on the ground but that is for another time. I want to concentrate on what He did when He got to the temple. Mathew 21:12, “Then Jesus went into the temple of God and drove out all those who bought and sold in the temple…”. The first thing He did in the temple was cleanse it. This bring us to 1Corinthians 3:16, “Know ye not that you are the temple of the living God, and the spirit of God dwells in you?”. First of all, Jesus said that He will destroy the temple and build it in three days to which He was referring to Himself, then Paul comes a long and reminds us that we are the temple of the living God. So when Christ was coming into the physical temple to cleanse it, He is coming to our spiritual temple to cleanse it. He has to rearrange, remove corruption and remind us of the main priority of the temple. Let’s look at three “Ps” in this text.

Mathew 21:13, “And He said to them, “It is written, “My house shall be called a house of prayer“. The first P is for PRAYER. He defined the house by calling it a house of prayer, I have no doubt that He has called my heart a heart of prayer. I’m not talking about the prayer of God bless this meal, I’m talking about effective prayers, the process of being connected to a heavenly circuit. Many are not progressing for they have power cables but they are doing nothing with them. The circuits are there only waiting for you to plug in your power cables. I don’t think you can progress without knowing that you have cables, know where to plug them in and how to plug them in. Prayer becomes your power cables. What are you doing with them?

Mathew 21:14, “The blind and the lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them“. Hooking your cables through prayer causes you to encounter with number 2 “P” for POWER. Prayer produces power when it’s connected right because as the scriptures says, first He cleansed the house, then He declared His house to be a house of prayer, then prayer produced the power to heal the blind and the lame in the temple. If you do not know what prayer does, there is no way you will pray. Prayers are like an energy that has force to get things moving, changing and transforming. In this case it has produced power to do exploits.

Mathew 21:15, “…the children crying out in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David!”, …, vs. 16, … And Jesus said to them, .. Have you not read, “Out of the mouth of babes and nursing infants, You have perfected praise”. The number 3 “P” is for PRAISE. Believe me when I say that power produces praise. Someone might say, suppose you pray and it did not happen, how will that produce praise? when I have prayed and it has produced power, that power will produce praise to believe God that even though He has not done it or done it yet, I still know He can do it, I know that He is able and I know it’s not about me but about Him so I praise Him any way. The three “Ps” have helped me grow in my prayer life to understand that PRAYER produces POWER, and power produces PRAISE. As I have said in the past, prayer is the vehicle God uses to get things done. Confess that you are a house of prayer and then live as a house of prayer.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 73:25&26, “Whom have I in heaven but You? And there is none upon the earth that I desire besides You. My flesh and my heart fail; But God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever”

There are times when you know what you should do but you are not doing them. You have the skills, you have the ability but the strength to make it happen is what is lacking. We know of the phrase from the bible, Mark 14:38 “…The Spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak“. The Spirit desires to win but for the winning to really take place, the Spirit has to get the flesh on the same page otherwise both will war against each other.

Have you been feeling so tired of late dragging your feet to do anything? Waking up is a struggle, praying is a struggle, so is reading the word. The Spirit is really willing but the flesh is just too weak to agree with the Spirit. There is war in the body and that war has to be overcome. I’m not even talking about sinning but having no strength to do what you and I should do to be even stronger. I need strength to move from point A to point B, I need to stay focused, I need to concur even more but I don’t have that strength.

The bible tells us of who we have in heaven, our heavenly Father, there is no doubt about that. The second thing is that who do we desire besides Him? This is a way to set priorities right for everything that we need revolves around our heavenly Father. He is the author of good things. Desire to seek His kingdom first channels other desires to be fulfilled for they are desires revolving around Him. The truth of the matter is that flesh will fail and so is the heart. I am yet to meet someone whose flesh and heart never fails. Flesh could fail in trials and temptations, heart could fail in the area of faith but the bible states it clearly, God is the strength of my heart. Why not, God is the strength of my flesh? God deals with the heart, if we allow Him get to the heart; the heart has a way of affecting the flesh to comply with the Spirit. Like mentioned, the Spirit (heart) is indeed willing, ready, expecting but what makes it fail is the flesh. Strength is the fuel that helps each of us accomplish what needs to be done. You can have vision, dreams, ambitions, and abilities but God strengthens us to bring those things to a completion. It’s just like you can make a body and it may look good and strong but without the breath of God, the body will do nothing. God’s strength is our breath, pumping the heart to keep beating and give life to the entire being. Philippians 4:13, “I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me”, you can endure all things because the heart has been given strength. Isaiah 26:4, “Trust in the Lord forever, For in Yah, the Lord is everlasting strength“, 2Corinthians 12:9, “My grace is sufficient for you, my strength is made perfect in weakness”, Psalm 46:1, “God is my refuge and strength…”. God has deposited many wonderful things in our lives; we now need His strength to make them happen. Let me also say that God’s strength is the heartbeat of our Christian living. Through His strength we can say no to sin, strength to worship Him, strength to reach out to others, strength to bring forth more spiritual babies. Take a closer look at your life and you will see that when strength is missing, doing God’s will becomes impossible. The truth has been revealed but the strength to function in that truth is what we need.

Seek strength from above, the breath of God to empower you to fulfill that calling, vision, dream, and desire. The fact that the spirit is willing is a sign that we need God’s strength.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1 Corinthians 11:1, “Be ye followers of me, even as I also am of Christ”, KJV

If you are anything like me, then you have someone or some people who inspire you especially in the spiritual arenas (our spiritual leaders). If you talk to different people, they will tell you of the people they look up to, people who give them a reason to pursue something bigger than them. People that gave them a reason to pursue what they never believed could ever happen. Joshua had a spiritual leader Moses, so was Elisha who had Elijah, Paul who had a Timothy to mention a few.

In his writing to the Corinthians, Paul opens with this line in chapter 11:1, “Be ye followers (imitators) of me, even as I also am of Christ”. Why did he not say “follow Christ as I follow Him“, because Paul knew to follow Christ meant laying it all on the line. He had learnt to pick up his cross and follow Christ daily. He had been a living example to many who might have not thought it possible to lay it all on the line and be like Christ. In Philippians 3:8, he says, “Yet indeed I also count all things loss for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them as rubbish, that I may gain Christ“. By the standards of the world before his conversion, Paul had it all, meeting Christ on his way to Damascus to persecute Christians altered and changed his life forever. He had not walked with Christ physically like the other disciple but to imitate Christ, he was going to have a taste of what it means to walk with Him.

Paul’s life was not an easy road, having been stoned and left to die, survived shipwreck, had been beaten, had been jailed, rejected yet in all this he was fulfilled because if Christ did not have it easy in this world and still accomplished his mission, Paul being a bond servant of the Lord saw himself finishing his mission through Christ who he imitated and gave him strength (Philippians 4:13). Something about Christ propelled Paul to ride out what had made many men give up. Something about Christ fascinated him that he tells us of his desire in Philippians 3:10, that I may know Him and the power of His resurrection, and the fellowship of His sufferings, being conformed to His death”. You would think that Paul desiring to imitate Christ was for him to be successful in this life, have a lot of money, have respect and be happy. It turns out that his desire was to operate in the power that resurrected Christ 1 Corinthians 2:4, “And my speech and my preaching were not with persuasive words of human wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power“, “And the fellowship of his suffering“, Paul had a taste of what it meant to suffer for Christ. “Being conformed to His death“. As Christ died for the purpose of redeeming sinners, so Paul had that same purpose in a lesser sense; he lived and would willingly die to reach sinners with the gospel. His life and death, though not redemptive, were for the same purpose as his Lord’s. In imitating Christ, Paul made himself of no reputation, he was a bondservant, humbled and was willing to suffer for Christ. I believe with all my heart that in his hard times, he would have not cried, “Jesus bring me OUT of this” his prayer would have been, “Jesus bring me THROUGH this“. For me to bring out is to escape, but to bring through is to endure.

By saying, “be ye followers of me, even as I also am of Christ” Paul is not suggesting to us that he counted himself something; he is teaching us what it means to follow Christ because he was a living proof. He was also glad that the Corinthians had received his teachings but he wanted to make it clear that He was not the head, that he was not making it by his own strength or his own teachings. This is why he pointed them back to his reason for being who he was. He tells them in vs. 3, But I want you to know that the head of every man is Christ,..﻿“

Our spiritual leaders ought to point us back to the head; Christ and their lives should be an imitation of Christ in everyway and if that’s not the case, then one should change the course. Their lives ought to be an example to us that despite how tough it is to pick up the cross and follow Christ, if they are making it through Christ who strengthens them, we too can through Christ who strengthens us. If we have other people who look up to us as spiritual leaders then like Paul let us strive to imitate Christ in every aspect of our lives. Paul had a desire to imitate Christ and also NOT fail Christ by leading the followers of Jesus a stray. What about you?

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Romans 12:21, “Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good”

There is a continuous struggle between the good we want to do and the evil that surfaces. You know for sure how much good you want to do and out of nowhere, this evil side of you shows up with an aim to over power you. And it becomes easy for you or other people to concentrate on the evil side than the good side. One little evil thing can ruin your reputation. We see this on TV, regardless of how many good things one has done; one negative thing contrary to one’s life style spoils everything. Now they become the talk of the town, press reports don’t portray the other good side of you.

Suppose you are in a communion service and the pastor says, “Before we have communion, if you have any faults with anyone, please walk over to them and confess it” and here you are closing your eyes thinking, “I bet when I open my eyes, there will be tons of people lining up to confess how they feel about me”, a brother comes to me and says, “Evans, for many months I always thought you were a rotten, self centered, arrogant person, please forgive me”. At that point he would have fixed his problem and I will have a problem with him for thinking of me that way. What can I say, man operates in this level that regardless of how many good things you have done, one small evil is enough to jeopardize everything depending on how we deal with it. What people see as our weakness is what kills us but that’s not necessarily the case for many times we get killed by our own guilt and shame. Your conscious tells you that you are wrong, a deep conviction comes within and now you have something to worry about and deal with.

With that in mind and knowing that we are humans, we all have faults in our lives? battling with anger, lust, frustrations, fear, doubt, compromise, anxiety, pride to mention but a few, you try very hard to deal with it, you even confess it but before long you are back to it again. You cry about being free and days you feel like you have overcome it but before long, you are back to the same thing. Been there, and still struggle with it. The message this morning is very simple and straight to the point, Romans 12:21, “Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good”, let no evil be the one to control you but let the good in you deposited by Christ chock out the evil in you. Look at your greatest strengths, the things in your life you are proud of, the things that people admire about in your life and begin to cultivate on those good things. Anytime you are overwhelmed by your evil side, don’t sit down and hold a pity party or go into depression, look at your strengths, pump life into your strengths and you will be amazed at how your strengths begin to chock out your weaknesses.

I have spent so much time trying to fix the bad that, I neglected the good God had deposited in me. In the bible we see so many people who had faults but the bible talks more about their strengths than their weaknesses. Though Moses sinned by disobeying the Lord, the legacy he left behind was that he was a friend of God. David is even worse, for David was weak sexually. We saw him commit adultery with Bathsheba, yet with all David’s weaknesses and failures he was known as a man after God’s own heart. He did not allow his weakness to put him down, he knew of his strengths for he was a worshipper, a man who will not do anything without checking with the Lord. He strengthened his confidence and trust in the Lord.

Taking something out of your life means that there will be a void somewhere within you and without replacing the old with something new, guess what? The old thing will come back and occupy the old spot (I am talking in terms of lets say a bad habit that you want to get rid of). Overcoming evil with good is also desiring by the help of God to deal with something and having something good in mind to replace it with. We give God the glory for He is ready to help us if we are ready to change 2Thessalonians 3:3, “But the Lord is faithful, who shall establish you, and keep you from evil”, Jude 1:24, “Now unto Him who is able to keep you from falling, and present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy”. I’m so glad that the Lord is able to keep me from doing evil and then present me faultless and spotless in the presence of His glory with exceeding joy. I want to reach and say though I had my own weakness, I overcame my weakness by working and doing good. Sinning is not good and the Lord hates it Proverbs 8:13, “The fear of the Lord is to hate evil: pride and arrogance, and the evil way and the forward mouth, do I hate”. As we work more on fearing the Lord which is doing His will, which is in line with His law, we will begin to hate evil and overcome it. Stop dwelling so much on your weaknesses and start working more on your strengths. A phrase that I like (I cannot remember who wrote it or said it) states, if you are going to love, love faithfully: if you are going to win, win gracefully: if you are going to learn, learn by teaching, and if you are going to fall, fall reaching. Change how you deal with your weaknesses!!!!

Have a blessed weekend

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 3:21, “﻿21﻿ And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skins, and clothed them,” (TRSV).
Adam and Eve disobeyed God, Eve was deceived and Adam listened to his wife and disobeyed God. Immediately they went into hiding because they were naked and a shamed of what they did. They tried to cover themselves with leaves, which did not do a good job as they were bound to dry and fall off.

Instead of taking responsibility for what they had done, they began to find excuses to blame for their fall. Adam blamed his wife, his wife blamed the serpent. Is this not true with us today, always finding it easy to blame something or someone for our mistakes? “She betrayed me, he tricked me, he made me do it etc”. People even blame God today for their mistakes saying “it’s God’s fault, He made me like this”. Shifting blames began in the first marriage and it’s still affecting us even today.

Out of what they had done, there came consequences yet in the midst of it all, God was merciful to cloth them. God had to slay the animals and shed their blood. The Lord furnished the skins, fashioned the garments, and clothed Adam and Eve. God did it all; they did nothing. After divine condemnation and judgment for this first sin, God acted in mercy to provide a way of salvation, and He demonstrated His grace to cover the shame of man.

Romans 4:7, “Blessed are those whose lawless deeds are forgiven, And whose sins are covered;” This does not mean God over looks our sins and neither did he overlook Adam and Eve’s sin by covering it up, this is God taking that which is naked and shameful and clothes it with Christ’s’ Righteousness. The first physical death should have been the man and his wife, but it was an animal—a shadow of the reality that God would someday kill a substitute to redeem sinners. Didn’t the Lord clothe us in our sin that rendered us naked and ashamed? What a kind God He is.

Romans 13:14, “But put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh, to fulfill its lusts”, Putting on the Lord Jesus not only covers our sins but it also protects us from exposing ourselves to sin and the desire to fulfill it. To put on the Lord Jesus also is to put on humility. We try to find ways to be worthy by trying to cover ourselves with the leaves of self righteousness but those leaves need to come down so that the God of grace and mercy can provide us with garments. The prodigal son in Luke 15 having been lost and found his way back home received a different treatment from what he had expected. The bible says, Vs 20 And he arose and came to his father. But when he was still a great way off, his father saw him and had compassion, and ran and fell on his neck and kissed him. 21 And the son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight, and am no longer worthy to be called your son.’ 22 “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the BEST ROBE (GARMENT) and PUT IT ON HIM, and put a ring on his hand and sandals on his feet. He uncovered himself by taking off the leaves by admitting his sin and his father demonstrated his love and compassion by putting on him the best robe. Notice that the prodigal son did not blame his age, the country he went to, what he got involved in, or what had happened to Him. He took responsibility for what he had done and cried for mercy. Proverbs 28:13

He who covers his sins will not prosper, but whoever confesses and forsakes them will have mercy.” We praise God for clothing us in spite of it all

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Leviticus 25:55, “For the children of Israel are servants to Me; they are My servants whom I brought out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God”

Difficult people to lead are those who come to a place with a different agenda. As I have said before, in general we human beings are selfish beings. We come for us, we come to receive and if we don’t get it as expected, frustrations crops in. Some have been so much affected that they left because they were not satisfied by the service they received. Do we ever stop and say, “What can I do as a form of service?” in other words, I have always come to receive, it is time for me to now give. No one teaches what service and giving is all about like Jesus, John 13:4, “rose from supper and laid aside His garments, took a towel and girded Himself. After that, He poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel with which He was girded”. The King of kings laid aside His Kingship garments (robe) and guarded Himself with a towel to serve those who considered Him their Teacher and Master. It’s easy to wash someone’s hair, they do it many times but washing someone’s feet? I mean going down on your knees to wash dusty, may be smelling feet? You have to be humbled to do that. Some would do it for money, Jesus was doing it out of love. Check out “fear factor” on TV and see what people would do for money. They risk their lives, doing weird things just to get money.

We love the phrase, son, daughter, royal priesthood, because it makes us feel important but to be called a servant sounds like an insult. Degrading position in human eyes yet we are called servants by God. Look at how God calls these men Genesis 26:24, “…I will bless you and multiply your descendants for My servant Abraham’s sake.”, Numbers 12:7, “Not so with My servant Moses; He is faithful in all My house”. Numbers 14:24, “But My servant Caleb, because he has a different spirit in him and has followed Me fully“, 2 Samuel 7:5, “Go and tell My servant David“. What is so common about these four men, they were great leaders yet they humbled themselves as servants and they served faithfully. God does not call them great, big, mighty names, He calls them MY SERVANTS. They served people yet they were doing it for the Lord. What did Jesus say to the disciples who were disputing on who is the greatest in the kingdom, Mark 9:35, “And He sat down, called the twelve, and said to them, “If anyone desires to be first, he shall be last of all and servant of all.” It’s not about titles, it’s about service. It’s about seeing what you can do for the Lord and rolling your sleeves to do it faithfully without complaining. Many pastor’s today want to lead like CEO’s rather than lead like a shepherd; a servant God has called them to be.

God says in Leviticus 25:55, “For the children of Israel are servants to Me…”, called for to fulfill tasks granted by God. Called to work and fight but under the guidance and supervision of the Lord. When they were told about a land flowing with milk and honey, maybe they thought they would just walk in and take it not knowing that there was work involved, (stooping down as a servants and working hard to get to that destination). See the flesh does not like the idea of stooping low and serving. This is the reason why I cannot pray, “LET ME BE A SERVANT”, I pray “MAKE ME (mold me) A SERVANT”. After all, what will the rest of the people think about us if we call ourselves servants? I don’t care about titles and positions, I would rather have the titles and positions define the office I am serving in and not what I am. All I care about is serving at any capacity because He has made me a servant. On that day I will not be introduced as thy good and faithful preacher, I will be introduced as Matthew 25:2, “…, “Well done, good and faithful servant“. Are you a servant at your job, in church, in your community? I’m not talking about title, I am talking about service, ask the Lord to make you one.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Isaiah 52:7, “How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news, who proclaims peace, who brings glad tidings of good things, who proclaims salvation, who says to Zion, “Your God reigns”.

To share along the lines my sister Sarah Susan shared on, let me share on a principle about “FEET” too. Isaiah 52:7, “How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news”, the word I pondered on for some time is the word “feet“, why does the bible when referring to the gospel uses the word “feet”? Romans 10:15, “How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the gospel of peace“, Ephesians 6:15, “and having shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace“. It talks about the shield of faith, the breastplate of righteousness, the helmet of salvation, the sword of the spirit. The word “feet” is not there just to fill in, it has a significant meaning. Feet help you relocate, it makes you move, it makes you go. When Jesus said, “Go ye into the world and preach the gospel“. The beginning word “GO” requires “FEET” that would mean on your prayers, put feet to it and go. I do not see anywhere in the scripture where it says “how lovely are the feet of those who sit“. You would imagine that those who sit have lovely feet because they are clean but the bible talks about those who go as the ones with lovely feet. Their feet may be full of dust, dragging, weary from walking, but they are still going because it’s the message that they have that makes their feet lovely. As I go out witnessing, I always have enough excuses as to why I should not go. When I go and it’s done, I come back rejoicing. Going up the mountain is tough and so is going after sinners but coming from the mountain is easy and relaxing and so is after witnessing, you come back rejoicing and relaxed.

Think of it this way, at a police station, they have a party and everyone has been invited including those who have broken the laws, they have a DJ, good food, gifts etc, tell me, how many would still show up at the party? very few. So is with the church, we are hoping that sinners will find their way to the church, we promise good music, spiritual food, a place of peace but still very few come. Why? because a guilty person will find it hard and intimidating showing up at a police station, we have to go out and apprehend them. Romans 10:14&15, “How then shall they call on Him in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe on Him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without a preacher? vs. 15, “And shall they preach unless they are sent?. Vs. 15 has been fulfilled when Jesus said, “go ye”, we are the preachers who will preach to them repentance and faith, the only two keys to salvation.

Here is what makes the feet of him that goes lovely, Psalm 119:105, “Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path”. Jesus Christ is the divine light, His words we preach is the lamp to our feet that causes us to have lovely feet and He lights our path towards sinners. “The lamp unto the feet” is for those who are moving. Could it be the reason Jesus washed the feet of the disciples so as to prepare them for the gospel? Then He said we ought to wash other people’s feet (sinners). The feet of those who have encountered with the Lord should bring good news (gospel), proclaiming peace, bring good things and proclaiming salvation. Jesus talked about a parable of a man leaving the 99 sheep found and going to look for that one which was missing, how about you?

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

The verse here is a symbolic expression of the bride’s behavior /way of life – “How beautiful your sandaled feet prince’s daughter, “Song of Songs 7 :1 How can a person’s feet become beautiful by being sandaled ? (Fragrance of sandal is quite famous)… These are the last days and God is looking at the preparation of His bride -the church…

“Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light for my path “Psalms 119 :105 Yes, King David never relied on the counselors or magicians or his advisers in the vast kingdom rather He depended on God for His counsel.. We all should be guided by the Word of God… When His Word guides and leads us, we can crush Satan as promised in Romans 16: 20 “The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet” That means ,if there is no peace in your life or in your family, there is definitely the role of the devil/the evil one …Only when we allow God to be Lord over our lives, He enables us to defeat the satanic forces and thus we can enjoy peace /serenity…Usually people tend to argue and fight with people but they do not realize that it is mainly the devil who provokes a person to get wild/angry and so on…The evil one operates behind the scene but only its works are manifested in people… as clearly stated in Ephesians 6 : 12″For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms” Yes, we need to fight the demon not people…Families are today getting shattered /broken just because husband and wife quarrel with each other ,not realizing the presence of the evil one ,which is the cause of this problem. Devil tries to influence either of the persons so that they cannot enjoy peace ….But our great God can help us to be more than conquerors in this evil world.

In Psalms 91 : 13 “You will tread upon the lion and the cobra , you will trample the great lion and the serpent” He will grant us victory over the demonic forces, dark world and spiritual forces of evil …”You have not handed me over to the enemy but have set my feet in a spacious place” Psalms 31: 8 He will safeguard us…Revelation 12 speaks of the bride of Christ who is clothed with the sun, crown of twelve stars on her head and moon under her feet ” We need to always suppress the worldly desires and the earthly pleasures (compared to moon here) but be clothed with the sun, ie the Sun of Righteousness Romans 13:14 speaks of being clothed with the Lord Jesus Christ

Romans 10:15 “How can they then call on the one they have not believed in ? How can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can they preach unless they are sent? As it is written” How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news”

Isaiah 52: 7 says “How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of those who bring good news, who proclaim peace, who bring good tidings, who proclaim salvation, who say to Zion”Your God reigns”Jesus has commissioned us “Go into all the world and preach the good news to all creation” Mark 16 : 15. Our Master ,who laid down His very life for us has not demanded expensive or costly things rather he tells us to preach about Him …If not ,how will the others, for whom Jesus has shed His blood know about this Supreme Sacrifice? Only when someone preaches, people hear and call on God as they believe in Him … So how are our feet? Are we quick to run to preach or are we hesitating or saying some excuses for this?

“Therefore put on the full armor of God, so that when the day of evil comes, you may be able to stand your ground and after you have done everything to stand. With your feet fitted with the readiness that comes from the gospel of peace.” Eph 6:15.

By Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Luke 4:8, “And Jesus answered and said to him, “Get behind Me, Satan! FOR IT IS WRITTEN, ‘You shall worship the LORD your God, and Him only you shall serve.'” Hebrews 10:7, “Then I said, ‘Behold, I have come-In the volume of the book it is written of Me-To do Your will, O God.'”

A police officer can only exercise authority because he has a badge that gives him that authority. As a Christian, we have the authority of the scripture to speak what it says rather than our own opinions and beliefs. Today people want to live by their own created beliefs, assumptions, ideas and the like. And the question that tends to run into my mind is, “by whose authority do you speak of these things?” Satan came to tempt Jesus in the wilderness and Jesus took the authority of the scripture, quoted it and stood by it. He told Satan, “It is written…”. The written word of God gives us the authority to speak it.

Many have a problem believing the story of Jonah and the whale, Jesus had no problem believing it because it was true and He was there when it happened, He quoted it Matthew 12:40, ” For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the great fish, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth”. In as much as we have our own ideas and thoughts of how things should be or should be dealt with, the Holy Scripture ought to be our final authority. And we can not pick and choose what we want to believe and agree with. We cannot also go around trying to find loop holes in the bible to support what we want to justify or smash our thinking as to what we believe the author meant. If I’m looking at a painting, my interpretation of the painting has no authority over what the painter meant for it to be when he painted it.

The Bible has been banned, burned, and, to some, supposedly “debunked,” yet still its truth stands. It remains the test of orthodoxy for all who claim to be of God or speak of God’s ways. 2 Tim 3:16 All Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness,” The most important thing about Scripture is not just that we read it or study it, but that we live it, that we obey the Lord (James 1:22). God did not give us His Word merely to inform us, but to change our lives therefore we receive it as it is even when we find certain verses hard to accept and follow. . As Mark Twain aptly put it, “it is not the things in the Bible that people can’t understand that prove troublesome, but the things they can understand. Even if people are convinced that the Bible is true from cover to cover, will they heed its message?”

Today the Bible’s credibility and authority are still attacked. Yet how many of its critics have carefully studied its teaching? How many have even looked at the story of how it came to be written? A careful reader will recognize that the Bible is not so much a single book as a library of sixty-six books. It contains a variety of literary genres: history, poetry, narrative, exposition, parable, and “apocalyptic”

The writers in the bible though different unified their stories, they offer the same understanding of God throughout. He is one God, Creator, Savior, and Judge. He is all-powerful, all-knowing, and eternal. His character is holy, good, loving, and just. They tell us of the human nature. People are made in God’s image and are capable of great good. Yet they are also sinful rendering man helpless under the weight of sin and only God made away of escape through His Son Jesus. They offer a common understanding of Jesus Christ. He is both God and man. He became a real human being in order to show the world the God it could not otherwise perceive. Something deeply significant happened as a result of His death on the cross, making it possible for God and humanity to be reconciled. They offer the same hope. God will accomplish His purposes for His creation.

Hebrews 10:7, “Then I said, ‘Behold, I have come-In the volume of the book it is written of Me-To do Your will, O God.’ Jesus came in the volume written of Him, quoted it as the truth because He is truth, the same reason the scripture should be our final authority. Men are pruned to error, God’s word has no error as many would want us believe the reason we have it as the final authority.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Galatians 6:6-10, “Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap”

As human beings we are drawn to good things and we do respond to good things. We are always attracted to the best and we desire the best in every aspect but at the same time we are reminded that good things never come easily, one has to work for them, has to for go certain things to be able to attain them. We also know that easy come most of the time becomes easy go, for what one has not sweated for can be replaced by something new. When you know that you gave up on certain things, or suffered to gain certain things you will cherish, nature and protect what you have gained at all cost.

We are also the type of beings who want to receive what we dish out. If we treat nicely, we expect the same to come back to us, if we love we want to be loved back and this often needs to take place more less at the same time meaning that if I become nice to you, in the next few minutes, hours, days I would expect the same from you. Acts 10:38, “how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him”. Jesus was anointed to do good without expecting the good to come back to Him. He knew of every thought, He knew everyone in and out and yet He still went about doing good. He was preparing His ground and sowing seeds knowing that they would not spring the next day or the next month as there would be a time when He would reap all that He sowed. John 12:24, “Unless the grain of wheat falls on the ground and dies, it abides alone but if it dies, it shall be able to bare much fruit”. He was sowing Himself as the seed that eventually He would bare more fruit. He was set for us an example that we may sow ourselves as good seeds to others. Sowing ourselves as seeds to others, work, home would also cause us to die to self.

Vs. 9, “And let us not grow weary while doing good, for in due season we shall reap if we do not lose heart”. How easy it is to be good to people who are good to us but the Lord is asking us to also be good to people who are not nice to us. We deal with different characters every day and at times you wish you would reach out and do something stupid but I have discovered that you can never fight fire with fire, if one starts with fire you better come with the goodness as the fire extinguisher as you will be amazed at how it works. Doing good I believe has no conditions but doing it whole heartedly for it’s not upon us to reap it from the same people but maybe different people. Doing good is not a seasonal thing but a continues thing regardless of the time. Vs. 10, “therefore we have opportunity, let us do good to all, especially to those who are of the household of faith”. This line is very true especially in our jobs, we have been given an opportunity by God to be good to our colleagues who might at times drive us crazy, customers who can be insensitive at times and the like for, we ought to shine every where we go. Math 5:16, “Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works (goodness) and glorify your Father in heaven”.

Phil 2:14-15, “Do all things without murmuring and complaining, that you maybe blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom you shine as lights in the world”. Being good to people who don’t deserve it helps us believers maintain our precious seed that will not be corrupted by someone else actions but at the same time, we are also instructed to do things without murmuring and complaining. Jesus did everything without complaining and reading Phil 2 shows what He reaped in the end. Our theme verse today is, “Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap”, God is seeing everything that we do and hears what we say. Whatever seeds we plant, at one point we will reap it. If you sow kindness, if not now, one day you will reap it if you don’t get weary in sowing it. If you sow hard work, if not now, one day you will reap it for God has stated reaped that He cannot be mocked in other words He cannot be fooled. He has all the records of our deeds Rev 22:12, “Behold I come quickly, and my reward is with me, to give every man according as his work shall be”.

Let’s sow every good seed we can find (peace, joy, respect, help, good workers etc) without expecting a return and let’s count Him faithful that has promised. You may not see the return now and it may not come from the people you expect it to come from and you may not be appreciated for the hard work you are doing and you might not even be recognized for the efforts made and you may deal with arrogant people, the key thing is to sow goodness at all times for it’s the Lord who rewards not men.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 139:1-24, “Search me, O God and know my heart; Try me, and know my thoughts (anxieties).

We looked at Psalm 139 yesterday to which we will finish this morning. Yesterday we looked at the common denominator word “YOU” which refers to God in everything and in every step of the way, for He knows us in and out, whether we be sleeping, waking up, talking, standing, fallen and so on and so forth, He still knows us. Let’s continue from vs. 15 of Psalm 139.

Vs 15, “My frame was not hidden from You, when I was made in secret, and skillfully wrought in the lowest parts of the earth”. My frame which are my bones which form the skeleton were not hidden from You Lord, after all You made me. I’m amazed how You applied skills in making my internal and external organs in secret that all people could see the finished product. You created my spirit out of nothing, formed my body out of something and breathed in me life and I became a living soul. My life is in your hands.

Vs. 16, “Your eyes saw my substance, being yet unformed. And Your book they were all written, the days fashioned for me, when as yet there were none of them”. Lord I could stop here for this is just too wonderful, You already knew how I would be born, how I would live and the days You fashioned for me in this world. You told Jeremiah that I have plans for you because before he was formed, You knew him and ordained him to be a prophet to the nations. He made us to glorify His name the reason He can brag on His handiwork”. vs. 17, “how precious also are Your thoughts to me O God”, Lord You think about me even when I don’t do the same many times, every single day of my life Your thoughts towards me surely stands and I know that they cannot be numbered. It’s not because I am worthy of that precious thought but because your loving kindness.

Vs 19-22, In these verses I know about who hate You and oppose Your existence oh God, they hate and blame You for certain things they had to go through but they forget to look at the great things that You have done in their lives already. No one can add even a second to their lives. We therefore humble ourselves for we are motivated by reality that without You we can do nothing.

Vs 23&24, “search me, O God, and know my heart, try me, and know my thoughts. And see of there is any wicked way in me and lead me in the way everlasting”. Lord in as much as there are people who don’t believe, live or even walk with You, there could be something in my life that could be holding me back from knowing You fully. I know You hate sin and do not want anything to take Your place in my heart. I could feel like everything is fine for your word says, “a man’s ways are pure in his own eyes”. You are the one to declare us righteous by what You do therefore search me O my God and know my heart,. Like a doctor who performs tests in a person to detect sickness, You are doing the same with my heart. Try me and know my thoughts that will reveal to me where my trust is in. Lord see if there is any wickedness (pride, hatred, anger, lust, resentment, un-forgiveness etc) in me and then lead me to Your everlasting way. Lord I could perform my own search but I know I might compromise your holiness by qualifying some sins so I give You permission to control. By this I mean not just be the Savior of my life but also the Lord of my life. NO ONE KNOWS ME LIKE YOU DO.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 139:1-24, “Search me, O God and know my heart; Try me, and know my thoughts (anxieties).

The Psalmist in this text had an encounter with God in a way that caused him to know that God has a perfect knowledge of man. He begins by saying in vs. 1, “O Lord, You have searched me and known me”, He knows me more than just my name, He knows me inside out. The Psalmist is giving us examples to show how the Lord knows him. You know my sitting and my rising up; You understand my thought a far off, God knows when we are weak and when we are strong. He knows when we need more and He knows our thoughts a far off, both wicked and pleasant thoughts. When you are thinking of what to say, He already knew what you were thinking and what you planned to say.

Vs 3, “You comprehend my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways”, Lord you understand when I take this road, when no one else understands me and when many criticize me for taking this path, You are the only one who understands. My lying down also is not news to You for You know when I am tired and weary, You protect me when I am lying down. How about vs. 4, “For there is not a word on my tongue, but behold, O Lord, You know it altogether”, I’m glad Lord that You know the words that are coming out of my mouth, You know what I’m trying to say, when I’m trying to say it and how I’m trying to say it, before I even pray, You already know what I’m going to pray about for nothing in my life escapes you. vs. 5, “You have hedged me behind and before, And laid Your hand upon me”, I remember when You told the children of Israel that You will go before them by day as a cloud of wind and by night as a pillar of fire, that is what I know You are doing in my life, for the wind cleans my path and the fire builds a hedge of protection around me and lights my path. When I feel like I’m alone, Your hand upon me gives me the assurance that I am not alone.

vs. 6, “Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; It is high, I cannot attain it“, Lord just being convinced up to this far that you know me blows my mind for it’s just to much to really understand that in as much as I do not know myself like I should, You know me better than anybody else in the entire world. vs. 7 “Where can I go from Your Spirit”, With all this knowledge about me Lord, where can I go where your presence is not there for You are everywhere. They call you Jehovah Shammah which means God present, You are our refuge and strength, a very present help. I am encouraged to know that I can never escape your presence for when I find myself in heaven one day, Your presence will be there. You are there in good times in my life and in bad times. And if I put my bed in hell which in other words if my actions, denials and rebellion puts me in a state where I feel like I am in hell, You will still be there with me because You know that by the time you are done dealing with me, I will be what You want me to be. Vs 12, “Indeed even darkness shall hide from You, But the night shines as the day; The darkness and the light are both a like to You“, Lord I’m reminded that you are not intimidated by darkness in my life for you see through and beyond the darkness. The moment You come in, darkness has no choice but to leave. Whatever is a mess in my life, You take it and turn it around to make something good out of it. You are the only God who has a way of taking my mess and making it into something useful. Thank You for taking me a mess and making me into a vessel of Honor to store treasure in.

Vs 13, “For You formed my inward parts; You covered me in my mother’s womb”, Lord the fact that You formed me blows my mind. You took time to make this being, crafted me in your arms. A lot could have killed me or caused me to be aborted or miscarried but You covered me, You protected me and natured me until I was ushered into the world but still you did not say the work is done.

Vs 14, “I will praise You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made, marvelous are Your works“, This is now too big to comprehend Lord, that out of the 6billion people on the earth, You fearfully and wonderfully made me that no one else is like me. To make it even interesting, You did not make me a junky but took time to form, fix, straighten me the original version and therefore there can be no one that can beat me being me. I’m a piece of art designed and developed at a time like this, marvelous are Your works and my soul knows it very well.

This is just too good to be true but it is, God knows each and every one of us in a way we could never understand. He can hear everyone at the same time and to prove what He can do, Math 10:30, “The very hairs on your head are numbered” not counted but numbered. In the whole devotion there is one little important word repeated over and over again, it’s the common denominator “YOU” which is God Himself, Without Him, we can do nothing. Why not sit back and let “YOU” take over your life. To finish in the morning.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Why We Should Give Thanks, by Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Why should we give thanks to God? King David sings in Psalm 103 regarding some of the major reasons why one should praise God

“Praise God O My soul all my inmost being, praise His holy name –who forgives all your sins “

A person very dear to us may somehow manage to forgive some sins but the important aspect in forgiving is “to forget”, which a mere human being cannot do…”Love keeps no record of wrongs” as per I Corinthians 13 .If God starts recording our wrongs/sins, then we cannot stand in His holy presence. The precious blood of Jesus is the ever ready solution for our trespasses so that immediately on confession, sins are washed out and we are justified to appear in His presence. He forgives “ALL OUR SINS” Sometimes people find it easy to forgive some sins but not all sins…We need to thank God for being so gracious for forgiving all sins, irrespective of the type or seriousness involved.

He heals all our diseases, yes God is a healer. There is no disease greater than God …”I John 4:4 says”The one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world” So God is greater than any disease or any sickness we face. Disease may not exactly be physical but also mental…Nowadays everywhere we see people suffering with depression/stress which are also classified as diseases. As we can see in the Bible, He can cure any disease, do any surgery (As He did in Genesis 2:21 ,where God did a surgery to Adam , in His sleep )..What a wonderful God we serve.

He redeems our lives from the pit ..There are occasions where people find themselves fallen/oppressed/downtrodden ..They are in a pit …Usually people in the pit are not even noticed…They are not only fallen on the ground but they are thrown /forced into a hole in the ground ???”King David narrates “Unless the Lord has been my help, I would have soon dwelt in the silence of death. When I said”My foot is slipping”your love O Lord supported me. When anxiety was great within me, your consolation brought joy to my soul” Psalms 94:18,19 Really there are times when we are in a pit of anxieties/tensions/worries but His love is our only support…”

He crowns us with His love and compassion…The unchanging God is God of compassion ….2 Corinthians 1:3 says He is a God of ALL COMFORT …People may definitely comfort us for a season but they may loose hope on us at times…God is a God of all comfort in all our troubles …Today people are crowned with problems and tensions, but we are so privileged to be crowned with love from God. Satan does not allow us to give thanks, he reminds us of some difficulties instead of counting the number of blessings showered on us… The crowns in this world are temporary…Today a person may be in very high authority /position but this would not last…He cannot enjoy it throughout his life…One day or the other, he has to retire from the post…

He satisfies our desires with good things…Our God always satisfies our desires when they are right of course …Whatever it may be, whether a job or a life partner or a house ..and so on. He is mindful of the smallest desire of each person …Really we have a wonderful God who caters to all our needs though He has many people to take care of he never makes mistakes in this process of supplying/providing ..That is why the saints sing in Revelation 15: 3 ”Great and marvelous are your deeds, Lord God Almighty, Just and true are your ways ,King of the Ages”

So that our youth is renewed like the eagle’s he satisfies our desires with good things so that we are renewed…It is not that He satisfies our desires today and not tomorrow. His supply is consistent and continuous…since He has everything in abundance…His supply will never run dry

So let us all resolve to praise Him at all times in all circumstances with all our mind and strength and soul. Amen!

Regards
Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 144:3&4, “Lord, what is man, that you take knowledge of Him?

What a Supreme Being is God that He knows who man is and still interested in him, this puzzles me everyday. Man fails God everyday by doing things not in line with His word. Man snatch things given to them and fail to give honor and thanks to the giver. How could He care for a bunch of complainers? He owes us nothing yet He still reaches out to us. He has blessed us so much but we are more concerned about what we have asked Him and has not done them yet. We want the good things He does for us but we don’t want to live for Him.

There is nothing that humbles me like people’s lives, though we don’t see many sick people out here, hospitals will paint a different picture. There are people going without food, don’t have a place to live, desire to be free to do things differently, have to walk to work, get paid less but don’t complain, have no bank account or if had, there is either nothing in it or less in it, don’t have friends or families. I don’t know whether you are getting the picture I am trying paint. God has blessed us far beyond what we could ever imagine or think and yet we are not qualified for them, we are not even better than those people who have something missing in their lives. Many have lost their lives through accidents but you and I have survived things that destroyed others. Some people who have things we feel like are missing in their lives yet they look comfortable and joyous. “Lord, what is man, that You take knowledge of Him? I wonder why God would be mindful of me when I know I am nothing.

Amazing because often we don’t stop to think about how the Lord has taken knowledge of us. We don’t stop and think how our lives would be without Him being involved. Even with that we fail to give Him Honor for who He is and what He has done in our lives. How often do you take time to thank God for your salvation, His Word, the air you breath, good health, freedom, food, shelter, family, friends etc . How about you prayed or asked people to pray for you and He did exactly what you prayed for? Honoring Him would mean, “Lord, You have done so much in my life, what do you require of me? what can I do apart from thanking You to show my appreciation for what You have done in my life”. We snatch things He has given us like spoiled brats and we disappear in the thin air until we are need again then we resurface. In Luke 17, there were ten lepers who upon seeing Jesus asked Him to have mercy upon them and heal them of their leprosy. Jesus having compassion on them directed them to go and show themselves to the priest and as they were going, they received their healing. Watch this, Luke 17:15&16, “And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified, and fell down on his face at His feet, giving Him thanks” Out of the ten, only one came back to give thanks, the rest snatched the healing and disappeared. Jesus got concerned about the other nine who received the same healing and did not come to give thanks. We can fail to give thanks because we think we deserved or earned the blessing. If we took time to pray for something and we received it, we need to take time to thank the Giver and desire to know what He requires of us. I don’t want to take the blessings God brings into my life for granted for it could have been me on the streets begging, it could have been me sick, it could have been me failing but He is mindful of me, Job 7:17, “What is man, that You should magnify him?”, He has made me bigger than what I was by myself, Job 15:14, “What is man, that he should be clean?”, I couldn’t make myself clean, Psalm 8:4, “What is man, that You are mindful of him? the son of man, that You visit him?. Because He cares so much for us, He has blessed us, what are we going to do? Lord, thank You, thank You, thank You, thank You for all You have done, for what You are doing and for what You will do. Have a thankful day, this week of thanksgiving. Happy Thanksgiving

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 24:21, “And the man, wondering at her, remained silent so as to know whether the Lord had made his journey prosperous or not”

The thought that God is on the move blows my mind. When the bible talks about the Spirit of God, it says, “The Spirit of God moved”. So expect the act of movement when you are dealing with prayers. The fact that my times are in His hands makes me be at peace for my hope is built on nothing less than Jesus. God knows what we need but He still requires us to move His hands by praying. Philippians 4:6, “Be anxious for nothing, but by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving, make your request be known to God“. Stop worrying about what has not happened yet or what should have happened by now and go back to calling His name when you do not know what to do. The servant had been given a task, he did not know what to do but pray and move.

Prayers cannot be successful without thanksgiving. The scripture from Philippians 4:6, says “..,with thanksgiving” makes it clear how thanksgiving is part of prayers. Thanksgiving is not only reserved when you have received it, it’s executed on the verge of waiting for it. This eliminates anxiety, frustrations and lack of patience. We write letters for job applications, at the end of the letter we tend to write, “thanking you in advance“, Pause for a sec, you don’t have the job yet and might not have it but there is a “thank you” word. You have faith based on your qualifications that you can get that job but you leave it in the hands of the hiring manager to make a decision. It’s the same way with prayer, you submit your request and conclude it with a thanksgiving. This means you have faith not in yourself but in God who is able to do it. Genesis 24:26, “Then the man bowed down his head and worshipped the Lord, 27, And he said, “Blessed be the Lord God of my master Abraham, who has not forsaken His mercy and His truth toward my master. As for me, being on the way, the Lord led me to the house of my master’s brethren. Though he had just seen the signs, he went and worshipped the Lord. Yes Rebekah had all the qualities he had prayed for, he gives her gifts but does not tell her why he is there and does not even know whether she and her family will accept the proposal but he worships God any way. He understands that God has led him this far and He will lead him that far. Those who are in God’s will are led of Him from the start to the finish. Psalms 37:23, “The steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord, and He delights in His way“. This is for those who are walking within the boundaries of God’s will. Being led means going somewhere and not just sitting and stagnant. Effective prayers call for a move. Moving from the familiar to the unfamiliar, from what you are used to, to what you are not used to. Greater things happen in the unfamiliar grounds. Therefore you pray, move as you are led and you see what you prayed.

Maybe you have prayed for something for a long time, you were specific, it was within the boundaries of His will. See what you prayed and know if the Lord made your JOURNEY (MOVE) prosperous or not. Be open to whichever way the Lord might speak to you because it might not always happen how you expected it. Give Him praise and thanksgiving while you are on the verge of waiting and know that your steps are ordered of Him. Find what His will is and stay in it if you ever want to succeed. You might have stepped out of it and went your way because you waited for too long. It’s never too late to get back on the track to be led by Him. God only delights in our ways when He orders our steps, when He goes before us, what prayers are about, we will be calling on God to lead. I believe that this is the year of God’s favor for some of you if not all. Don’t be surprised when you see what you prayed being manifested because it was within God’s will. We are yet to hear testimony after testimony of what the Lord is doing. One last thing, I believe in praying with eyes opened, praying and watching to see when the Lord is passing by. SEE WHAT YOU PRAYED, blessings Ev

Thanks
Evans
