title.rendered: Teaching On Doctrine Essentials, Part 2, by John F. MacArthur (Complied by Evans Olang)

content.rendered:
Good morning,
III. Everything Essential to Saving Faith Is Fundamental
Third, a doctrine must be regarded as fundamental if eternal life depends on it. Scripture is full of statements that identify the terms of salvation and the marks of genuine faith. “Without faith it is impossible to please Him, for he who comes to God must believe that He is, and that He is a rewarder of those who seek Him” (Hebrews 11:6). That verse makes faith itself essential to a right relationship with God. It also expressly identifies both the existence and the veracity of God as fundamental articles of the Christian faith.

Elsewhere we are told that eternal life is obtained through the knowledge of the true God and Jesus Christ (John 17:3; 14:6; Acts 4:12). Since Jesus Himself is the true God incarnate (1 John 5:20; John 8:58; 10:30), the fact of His deity (and by implication the whole doctrine of the Trinity) is a fundamental article of faith (see 1 John 2:23). Our Lord Himself confirmed this when He said all must honor Him as they honor the Father (John 5:23).

The truths of Jesus’ divine Sonship and Messiahship are also fundamental articles of faith (John 20:31).
Of course, the bodily resurrection of Christ is a fundamental doctrine, because 1 Corinthians 15:14 tells us, “If Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is vain, your faith also is vain.”

Romans 10:9 confirms that the resurrection is a fundamental doctrine, and adds another: the lordship of Christ. “If you confess with your mouth Jesus as Lord, and believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead, you shall be saved.”

And according to Romans 4:4-5, justification by faith is a fundamental doctrine as well: “Now to the one who works, his wage is not reckoned as a favor, but as what is due. But to the one who does not work, but believes in Him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is reckoned as righteousness” (emphasis added). In other words, those who seek acceptance before God on the ground of their own righteousness will find they fall short (Romans 3:27-28; Galatians 2:16-3:29). Only those who trust God to impute Christ’s perfect righteousness to them are accounted truly righteous. This is precisely the difference between Roman Catholic doctrine and the Gospel set forth in Scripture. It is at the heart of all doctrine that is truly fundamental.

In fact, an error in understanding justification is the very thing that was responsible for the apostasy of the Jewish nation: “For not knowing about God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own, they did not subject themselves to the righteousness of God” (Romans 10:3). Is that not the precise failure of Roman Catholicism? But “Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes” (v. 4). In chapter 5 we will return for a closer look at the doctrine of justification by faith.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Teaching On Doctrine Essentials, Part 1, by John F. MacArthur (Complied by Evans Olang)

content.rendered:
Good morning,
I began a study on “Doctrine Essentials” from Apostle John’s epistles. The doctrine essentials are the foundation. Apostle John makes Christology the central doctrine of the faith and Paul solidifies with this scripture, “No man can lay a foundation other than the one which is laid, which is Jesus Christ” (1 Corinthians 3:11). Thought of sharing in parts this teaching by a bible teacher John F. MacArthur, a man I respect. Ev

How are we able to determine what doctrines are essential?
To begin with, the strongest words of condemnation in all the New Testament are aimed at false teachers who corrupt the Gospel. Therefore the Gospel message itself must be acknowledged as a primary point of fundamental doctrine.

But what message will determine the content of our gospel testimony? The biblical message of instantaneous justification through faith alone-or a system of rituals and sacraments that are supposed to convey grace to the participants with no guarantee of ultimate salvation? What authority will we point people to? The Scriptures alone-or a papal hierarchy and church tradition? Those two gospels are flatly contradictory and mutually exclusive.

All these considerations determine what message we proclaim and whether that message is the authentic Gospel of true Christianity. Therefore we are dealing with matters that go to the very heart of the doctrines Scripture identifies as fundamental.

Can we get more specific? Let’s turn to Scripture itself and attempt to lay out some biblical principles for determining which articles of faith are truly essential to authentic Christianity.

I. All Fundamental Articles of Faith Must Be Drawn from the Scriptures
First, if a doctrine is truly fundamental, it must have its origin in Scripture, not tradition, papal decrees, or some other source of authority. Paul reminded Timothy that the Scriptures are “able to make thee wise unto salvation” (2 Timothy 3:15, KJV). In other words, if a doctrine is essential for salvation, we can learn it from the Bible. The written Word of God therefore must contain all doctrine that is truly fundamental. It is able to make us “adequate, equipped for every good work” (2 Timothy 3:17). If there were necessary doctrines not revealed in Scripture, those promises would ring empty.

The psalmist wrote, “The law of the Lord is perfect, converting the soul” (Psalm 19:7). That means Scripture is sufficient. Apart from the truths revealed to us in Scripture, there is no essential spiritual truth, no fundamental doctrine, nothing essential to soul-restoration. We do not need to look beyond the written Word of God for any essential doctrines. There is nothing necessary beyond what is recorded in God’s Word.

This, of course, is the Reformation principle of sola Scriptura-Scripture alone. According to the Bible itself, no supposed spiritual authority outside “the sacred writings” of Scripture can give us wisdom that leads to salvation. No papal decrees, no oral tradition, no latter-day prophecy can contain truth apart from Scripture that is genuinely fundamental.

II. The Fundamentals Are Clear in Scripture
Second, if an article of faith is to be regarded as fundamental, it must be clearly set forth in Scripture. No “secret knowledge” or hidden truth-formula could ever qualify as a fundamental article of faith. No key is necessary to unlock the teaching of the Bible.

The truth of God is not aimed at learned intellectuals; it is simple enough for a child. “Thou didst hide these things from the wise and intelligent and didst reveal them to babes” (Matthew 11:25, KJV). The Word of God is not a puzzle. It does not speak in riddles. It is not cryptic or mysterious. It is plain and obvious to those who have spiritual ears to hear. “The testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple” (Psalm 19:7).

The point is not that every fundamental article of faith must be supported with an explicit proof text. The doctrine of the Trinity, for example, is certainly essential to true Christianity–and it is very clear in Scripture–but you will find no comprehensive statement of the Trinity from any single passage of Scripture.

This does not mean that a doctrine must be non-controversial in order to be considered a fundamental article. Some would argue that the only test of whether something is essential to true Christianity is whether it is affirmed by all the major Christian traditions. By that rule, hardly anything of any substance would remain to distinguish the Christian Gospel from the “salvation” offered by pagan morality or Islamic theology. “There is much truth in the remark of Clement of Alexandria; ‘No Scripture, I apprehend, is so favorably treated, as to be contradicted by no one.'” (Herman Witsius, Sacred Dissertations on the Apostles’ Creed [Phillipsburg, NJ: Presbyterian & Reformed, 1993 reprint], 1:21)

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 9:14-29, “So he said to them, “This kind can come out by nothing but prayer and fasting”

We looked at faith to which I will link with two other important things. A child was brought to the disciples to heal but without the presence of Jesus (He was up on the mountain), they were unable to cast out the demon in a boy who was possessed. When the multitude saw Jesus coming, they left the rest of the disciples to meet Him. The bible says, “Whatever is impossible with man, is possible with God and we thank God for His presence to make a difference. His presence alone gives us comfort and courage that all is under His control. Even if He does not fix everything in our lives, the fact that He is present with us in a situation is enough. If He did not fix me, He touched me and His touch kept me from giving up, giving in, throwing in the towel. I have things I have prayed to Him to deal with that have not happened yet but because He keeps touching me when I have to face these things, gives me the strength to linger longer.

So Jesus showed up and He inquired what was going on. Vs 17-18, “Then one of the crowd answered and said, “teacher, I brought my son, who has a mute spirit….So I spoke to Your disciples, that they should cast it out, but they could not”. The number one thing about this line was faith, they should have asked themselves WDJD – “What Did Jesus Do” in situations like this? The bible says, “these signs shall follow them that believe, in my name they shall cast out devils…”, They were in a position to do what the Master had been doing but because of unbelief as I look at it, they were unable. There were two other things that was required to make this complete. Heb 11:6, “Without faith it is impossible to please Him for He that comes to God must first believe that He is and that He is a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him”. He asked that they bring the boy to Him.

Something interesting is that, when the boy was brought to Jesus, the spirits in the boy became violent, threw the boy on the ground and did all kinds of crazy things to the boy but one thing I love about Jesus, none of these intimidated Him. There is no situation or circumstance in our lives that intimidate Him, just because it’s worse in our lives and we cannot see the way out can’t stop Jesus from making something good out of it. Jesus had no problem healing the boy but wanted to make sure that the father of the boy was on the same page, the father said vs22″…But if You can do anything, have compassion on us and help us”. Here is a man who brought his son to Jesus for healing, already the disciples have failed to do the job, this man’s faith is shaken because when he needed help the most, the people he thought could offer him help were unable to do so, when he saw Jesus he used the word “BUT IF”, this indicated his faith was not strong. We need to replace our “Ifs” with “WHEN” for “if” is for those who have doubt, “when” is for those who have faith in Christ for victory. vs. 23 “Jesus said to him, If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.” Immediately the father of the child cried out and said in tears, “Lord, I believe; help my unbelief”. I thought for a minute, the father said he believed and again he says, help my unbelief? I believe the fathers’ child had strong faith when he came but after meeting the disciples, his faith was shaken and Jesus wanted to bring him back to the first faith he had when he brought his son. And we all know the rest of the story, Jesus cast out the demons and the child was made whole again.

Afterwards the disciples asked Jesus why they could not cast out the demon from the child. After hearing what Jesus had to say, I believe that they had faith that was needed to get the job done but this type needed something more than faith and that is prayer and fasting. vs. 29, “So He said to them, “this kind can come out by nothing but prayer and fasting”. Faith fuels one to pray, for prayers calls those things which are not as though they were, you call them into existence by faith and for a quick process fasting comes in handy. You can have faith but unless it’s mixed with prayers and at times with fasting, greater things will never be achieved. Prayer paves a way for God to move. Prayer is the heavy machinery brought to the construction site to help dig out demonic forces and construct something new. If you only had faith, let me tell you that there is more to it and that is having prayers and fasting as part of your life. Are you praying and if so, are you praying like you should? Have you fasted and prayed before? if so when was the last time you prayed and fasted. I am affected by all the three and I need more than what I’ve got. There is More!!!.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 9:14-29, “So he said to them, “This kind can come out by nothing but prayer and fasting”

If you have been to a construction site, you will have an idea of what kind of construction to expect by the construction machines brought to the site. If heavy machinery are present, you can conclude the construction expected won’t be small thing. The bigger the job, the bigger and the heavier machines.

It happened on one particular day Jesus went to the mountain with three of His closest friends Peter, James and John. The rest of the disciples were left at the bottom of the mountain. These disciples had always been with Jesus and anytime they brought someone who needed a miracle, they were there to witness Jesus perform a miracle. On this particular day, Jesus was not present with them; he was up on mountain where He was transfigured while the rest of the disciples for the first time I believe were faced with a challenge of casting out a demon from a possessed child. What are you to do when the one who always make things happens is missing in action?

Have you always watched someone do something in your presence and then one day that person is not available and a situation arises needing urgent attention and you are expected to be the one to do what you have always watched someone else do? If you have not, the time is coming when you will face them. These are the times your faith is tested to see exactly where it stands. We have had teachings on faith and more, but I wonder whether we put it into practice. One time I took a group to six flags in Massachusetts, we went on different rides, really scary rides. This was my first time; I remember closing my eyes on the first few I went on. Some of the guys refused to go on the big ones. Some guys expected me to cave in with the rest but I began to learn something about faith in that. I told myself I wasn’t going to back off or close my eyes for the rest of the rides because my faith was built to know that the guys who built those rides knew how safe they are, and to go at such speed and not crush gave me greater confidence. I knew that there were so many people who had been on these rides before me and they made it. I began to think about how many people have walked by faith in the Lord and how God gave them victory. Some of the life rides were so scary, doing high speeds, going through tunnels, dropping 221 feet at a high speed and all they could do was hang in there and trust God to bring them safely to the finish line. We have watched the people who have gone before us, can we have the kind of faith they had. Hebrews 11 tells us more about people who walked by faith and did things by faith. This should serve as a point of reference to all of us. If we can trust certain things created by man, how much more should we trust God even for greater things. Psalm 118:8, “It’s better to trust in the Lord than to put your confidence in man”. Men have faith on the man made rides, how much more can we trust God then.

Our first great lesson out of this is FAITH. To continue

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: In His Time, Part 3, by Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“GOD MADE EVERYTHING BEAUTIFUL IN ITS TIME” Ecclesiastes 3:11

Exactly the night before Haman was to speak to the king to have Mordecai hanged, God did not allow the king to sleep. Sleep is ordered by the Lord. “He grants sleep to those He loves” Psalms 127.Praise Him…Only those who are peaceful can have a good sleep. In fact it is a blessing from the Lord. After slogging for the entire day, sleep during the night is a gift from the Lord, wherein we get rest and also get refreshed/revived for the next day ahead… Though we all sleep and rest, our God never slumbers or sleeps but keeps watching over us…Psalms 121: 3 …What a loving Father we have …Even our beloved mother or dear ones sleep ignoring us but our Lord keeps safeguarding us ..never to slumber or sleep

Now the king had learnt that Mordecai was due to be honored and Haman was not aware of all this. When he comes to know that the king wanted to honor someone, he gives excellent suggestions ,to the maximum extent possible, thinking that the person king wanted to honor is none other than himself…But God started turning the tables. Though he planned maximum harm for Mordecai, God made the same Haman plan maximum amount of honor ,without his knowledge … Nothing less than a miracle…

Immediately on hearing that the King had exalted Mordecai, Haman’s wife Zeresh and advisers said ”Since Mordecai, before whom your downfall has started is of Jewish origin, you will surely come to ruin. You cannot stand against him” Esther 6:13 While they were uttering these words, the kings eunuchs arrived and hurried him away to the king.. What do these words mean “You cannot stand against him” God had promised to Joshua in Joshua 1: 5 “No one will be able to stand up against you all the days of your life. I will never leave you nor forsake you” Yes, the words of the Lord are true…He led Joshua victoriously …”No weapon formed against you will prevail” Isaiah 54 :17 Yes, nothing designed ,however well planned against the children of God can prevail. We need to claim this promise.. The Devil cannot prevail… Praise the Lord. We are privileged to be in the hands of the Mighty one..

The same gallows Haman built for Mordecai was finally used to hang him. and the same honor he planned for himself ,God reserved for Mordecai…”Blessed is He who trusts in the Lord “Proverbs 28 : 25 says” He who trusts in the Lord will be prospered”

God intervenes at the right moment…Are you worried that people around you prompted by the devil are planning some harm for you? Are you getting upset that the children of the enemy are flourishing ? …They may flourish as the green grass but it is only for destruction forever …We are safe in His hands …

”The dragon stood in front of the woman who was about to give birth so that he might devour her child the moment it was born. She gave birth to a son, a male child, who will rule all the nations with an iron scepter. And her child was snatched up to God and his throne” Revelation 12 :4 Yes the devil is ready to take us alive but the Lord says ”Lo, I am with you always” God is with us to protect us and safeguard us …The devil, the dragon was waiting for the opportune /appropriate moment to devour the child. Right from the beginning of accepting the Lord to the point of entering the Lord’s kingdom, Satan is after us, to steal, kill, and destroy…. But the male child, symbolic of the bride, will be snatched up to God and we will be ruling all the nations with an iron scepter … Praise God. Though our beginning was humble, God will exalt us at the right time…

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: In His Time, Part 2, by Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“GOD MADE EVERYTHING BEAUTIFUL IN ITS TIME” Ecclesiastes 3:11

Well, meanwhile, Haman gets excited about his plan and that all the Jews will be destroyed forever. He is happy and in high spirits, calls his friends and wife Zeresh and boasts about his vast wealth, his many sons, all the ways the king exalted him and how he was elevated above the other nobles and officials… “Pride goes before a fall”.. To add to all this, his friends and wife suggested Haman to have a seventy five feet gallows built for Mordecai in order to hang him on it …And this suggestion delighted Haman according to Esther What delights you? Do suggestions of beloved people delight you? Or the Law of the Lord? Does the word of God delight you? Delight is the highest level of ecstasy or happiness or joy or pleasure or contentment. Psalms 1:4 speaks of delighting in the law of the Lord…Does the word of God delight you? Does the word of God pour life into you as in the case of David?

Though Mordecai was aware of all this, he never got worried or never panicked. He never complained to God “Haman was vile/evil, then why is he being blessed or exalted above others and that too above me? Why should not that exaltation happen to me as I am God fearing and devout? Why should the plans of vile Haman come into action and also been approved by the king? Those plans could have been stopped but why did God allow all this in my life? To worsen the situation, gallows also are built. God could have stopped the gallows being built and what not ”

Mordecai was quite composed and humble under Gods mighty hands to exalt him at the due time …Never did Haman’s boasting or his feasts upset Mordecai…In all these happenings, apparently God looks to be silent ..Why? He let the enemy work to its best …He let the enemy plan the worst ..he let the enemy get excited to the maximum … Though he appears to be silent, He is working behind the scene..

King Nebuchadnezzar was furious with Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, Gods children when they disobeyed his command to serve other gods or worship them…Though he was quite favorable towards them till that moment, his attitude immediately changed and he ordered that the furnace be heated seven times hotter than usual… Yes people are prone to change…However close or dear to us, they are subject to change depending on the situations/circumstances…But our father never changes …He is the same yesterday, today and forever…What a comfort to have a God/guide/friend who never changes… who loves us in the same way, though we are prone to change parties or change colors … These children of God were never worried that the furnace was getting hotter …never questioned God” God could have changed the king’s heart…He could have stopped the king from throwing into fiery furnace…”To add to all this, the furnace was seven times hotter…But God was watching the situation… He let the enemy carry out his plan with much energy and excitement but He intervened just at the right time in the furnace. The blazing furnace had killed the soldiers who tied up the children of God to throw into the furnace but these people were completely protected. Praise the Lord ! To continue

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: In His Time, Part 1, by Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“GOD MADE EVERYTHING BEAUTIFUL IN ITS TIME” Ecclesiastes 3:11
What is “its time” and what is “our time?” Let us meditate on it ….Many times, we tend to be in a hurry regarding things in our day today life. Occasionally, if there is a delay, we panic…Things are not moving as we had expected…Thus there is also some discouragement /frustration ..and we cannot wholeheartedly praise Him for all His works.

Psalms 92 : 4 says “I sing for joy at the work of your hands” Are we able to sing with David ,praising God at every situation we face Or are we murmering, complaining, and grumbling at certain situations, which God has allowed into our lives?….Romans says “And we know that in all things ,God works for the good of those who love Him ,who have been called according to His purpose” Are we twenty four hours and three hundred and sixty five days aware of this fact ? When things do not go our way, we feel our prayers are being unanswered …

Whatever God does, is for our best interest…This is well proved in the book of Esther …When Haman the Agagite ,honored by the King and all the royal officials, observes that a Jew named Mordecai was not kneeling or paying him honor, he gets enraged and along with other officials plots a plan to destroy, kill, and annihilate all the Jews on a single day ….These days, Satan the enemy is roaming like a roaring lion seeking whom to devour and his aim is to steal, kill and destroy us …John 10:10 He steals our joy in the Lord, makes us believe what circumstances have to teach us rather than the word of God…Once we start looking at the circumstances /prevalent situations, we tend to loose faith and focus on the problems, worrying, getting depressed, brooding .Instead of basing ourselves totally on God’s reliable word , we meditate on our tough situations …As a result we cannot rejoice in the Lord

Now how did Mordecai react to Haman’s plan? Did he get depressed or defeated? On the contrary he was fasting, weeping, and wailing and then persuaded Queen Esther for help.. He counsels Queen to plead the King for all the Jews and in the process, he ensured that all the Jews would fast for 3 days…Mordecai never based himself on Queen Esther as in Esther 4: 14 “For if you remain silent at this time, relief and deliverance for the Jews will arise from anther place” Yes, this is true…there are times , people tend to rely more on rulers, authorities, or kings than on the Lord Psalms 118.3 “It is better to take refuge in the Lord, than to trust on men ..It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in kings”. Psalms 3.8 says”Deliverance is from the Lord” …The horse is made ready for the day of battle but victory rests with the Lord Instead of basing on God, we expect relief or deliverance from people,…But Mordecai is a classic example of relying on the Lord…He requests Esther’s help but tells her that deliverance or relief will arise from some place if she does not help…He does not totally depend on Esther, though she is in authority ….

To continue

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Leviticus 17:11, “For the life of the flesh is in the blood…”

John 15:7, “If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, you will ask what you desire, and it shall be done for you”. Yesterday we talked about the bleeding believer who needs to abide in the vine, today I want us to concentrate on “If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you“ It’s good to abide which in another translations says “remain”, we also need to allow the Words of the Lord to abide (remain) in us. The reason why the word needs to remain in us is because that it is the blood to sustain and fuel us to move everyday in Him. Check how John reveals to us how the Word is connected to the Lord John 1:1-5, “In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. He was in the beginning with God. All things were made through Him, and without Him nothing was made that was made. In Him was life, and the life was the light of men. And the light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it”. He was and is the Word, and in Him was life and according to Leviticus 17:11, “For the life of the flesh is in the blood…”, His Word is life and blood to us. Check how He came to us in John 1:14, “And the Word became flesh (blood) and dwelt among us”. When He broke the bread with the disciples at the last supper, He said eat this bread which represents my body broken for you and the bread is also known as the Word of God. He also said drink this wine which represents the blood of the Lamb shed on the cross of Calvary. Thank God that His blood can now flow in our streams because we are abiding and we can live because He lives. We are not connected to a dead Vine but a living Vine for He is life. The more we know the Word, the more we know Him. The more we can live according to His Words, the more we are imitating the Life of Christ. His words abide in you, His words would steer in the right direction and you will not even work hard to bear fruit, they will come because you are abiding. The reason why the moon shines is because it draws its light and strength from the Sun. We as believers draw our light for the Sun Jesus and we become the Moon that will shine in the middle of darkness., Matt 5:16, “Let your light so shine before men that they may see your good works and glorify your Father which is in heaven”.You will not bear fruits (shine) unless you abide in Him and His words abide in you. We try so hard to produce fruits while in actual sense we need to abide in Jesus and His Blood and Word will help us grow.

I want us to understand that the Word can speak on it’s own. Someone said the Word of God does not need an attorney or witnesses, it is able to defend itself anywhere at any time. The Word is powerful and cannot be changed or altered. When we have no voice and at times cannot defend ourselves, the Word of God will stand for sure. The Word will speak in us and for us and at the same time the Word will speak out of us. The moment that the Word leaves us, it does not loose the power and strength but we who have lost it will. Gen 4:10, “… the voice of thy brother’s blood cries out to Me from the ground”. When Cain slew Abel, Abel died but his blood cried out to God from the ground when it could not speak from the body anymore, now in Hebrews 12:24 says, “And Jesus the mediator of the new covenant, and the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better things than that of Abel”. I would rather have the Blood and the Word speak through and in me than from somewhere. My prayer for you is that you continue to abide in the True Vine and His Word will abide in you. We can be encouraged in this discouraging world. Let the blood of Jesus that speaks louder than Abel’s’ circulate in our systems, our lives depend on Him for without Him, WE ARE NOTHING. Let’s move from being BLEEDING BELIEVERS to BLENDING BELIEVERS. Blending believers will seize the opportunity to blend in the Lord.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Leviticus 17:11, “For the life of the flesh is in the blood…”

We looked at the bleeding Savior who chose to bleed for the sake of mankind and today we will look at the bleeding believer.

John 15:7, “If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, you will ask what you desire, and it shall be done for you”. One of the most tragic things that can happen to human beings is to have a cut, a wound and bleed to death. There is something about the blood circulating in human system that has to be protected by all means. We give out blood for other patient lives to be saved. The bible indicates clearly that the life of the flesh is in the blood and the life of the gospel is in the blood, and the life of every believer is in the blood and so we need to take the blood issue seriously.

If you go back to John 15:5, “I am the Vine and you are the branches. He who abides in Me, and I in him, bears much fruit; for without me you can do nothing”. If we are ever to allow blood to continue to circulate and stay alive and well, we got to be connected to the source of life which is Jesus Christ. John 14:6, “Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me”. The only way we can get to the Father is by being connected to the Son. I think that one of the things that make it hard for us at times, is being able to distinguish between who the Vine is and who the branches are. I’m not surprised for I have seen people reverse the order and they acted as though they were the Vine and Jesus was the branch and by this I mean that everything someone did, they thought they were doing the Lord a favor when in the actual sense, He is doing us a favor.

Listen to this, the bleeding believer is one who decides to be disconnected from the true Vine. For example, if you cut someone’s hand, that hand will die and rot but the entire body will still live though in pain. John 15:4, “… As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it abides in the Vine, neither can you, unless you abide in Me”. You detach yourself from the Lord you will bleed to death meaning spiritually die. If you detach a hand from the body yes it will still look like it’s living and kicking but give it some more time as it looses blood and you will see it die, no more life let in it. We got to stay attached to the Vine everyday. No moving forward without being attached to the Vine and to be honest with you, it’s not easy staying attached to the Vine. You can not have the fruit of the Spirit recorded in the bible (love, patience, kindness, meekness, long suffering etc) without being attached to the Vine, Don’t you understand that Christ in you the hope of glory??? without Him we can do absolutely nothing?.

The bleeding believer cannot retain anything for they are bleeding daily, you pour strength into them, tomorrow they are weak again; you encourage them today, they will be discouraged tomorrow; you tell them you love them, they don’t feel loved enough; you speak destiny in their lives, they see themselves as failures, why? because everything you pour into their lives bleeds out. In as much as someone might encourage and strengthen you as long as you are bleeding, you will never retain for long. If you are the one to lift up a bleeding believer, if you see them the next day and the day after come to you with the same issue, they must be bleeding.

With God where there is a problem, He has provided a way out. Ask yourself the first question, are you detaching yourself from the True Vine? you could be attached to a vine but not the true one and in the process of being detached from the wrong one, you will bleed but the good news is, you can be grafted onto the True Vine. Ask yourself why you cannot hold that which is poured into you, is it because of sin?, wounded by someone?, offended, broken?. Bind up the bleeding wounds, purpose in your heart to stop the bleeding in you. Phil 2:12, “…work out your own salvation with fear and trembling”. No one can work your salvation for you. You have to do it yourself, you have to desire to live and do everything by all means to stop yourself from bleeding to death and let someone come and help you bind up the wound. Remember the woman with the issue of blood, she was bleeding too and she purposed in her heart to work out her own salvation by looking for and to Jesus and speaking to herself “If I may but touch the hem of His garment, I know I will be made whole”. And the moment she touched His garment, she got attached to the True Vine and her bleeding stopped. God will send people to pour more into you but make sure you are abiding in Him the True Vine.

I will stop here for the day, one last piece on part three tomorrow

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Leviticus 17:11, “For the life of the flesh is in the blood…”

I for one believe in a believer’s growth, I’m always quick to tell whether I am growing or stagnant. I am bothered when I am not growing and I begin to look for opportunities to grow in Christ even more. One of the things that has helped me grow in Christ in the last few years is reaching out to the lost on the streets. It’s so fulfilling, growing while reaching others, eye opening, learning experience, and appreciating grace more and more as I thank God for having saved me.

In John 15:5 “I am the vine, you are the branches. He who abides in Me, and I in him, bears much fruit; for without Me you can do nothing”. As the vine, He is always, then question is, are we abiding that we may bear fruit?. The bible does not say that you shall produce fruits, it says “you shall bear fruit” which I could say carry. If you can withstand abiding, you don’t even have to struggle to bear fruits, they will flow because you are abiding.

There is something about a biding we can learn by first seeing how it all started, John 19:34, “But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out”. In my reading about the life of Christ, not at any given moment do I hear that Christ bled until the hour was getting nearer and nearer for His crucifixion. As He was praying in the final hours, He was sweating blood. Then we see blood again when they whipped him on the whipping post, then when they forced a crown of thorn on His head, when they nailed Him on the cross and when the Roman soldier pierced Him on the side. I have seen that if someone has a cut, the first thing they try to do is prevent the cut from bleeding by all means for there have been people who bled to death. Jesus on the other hand was bleeding from being beaten with a whip, bleeding from the crown of thorn forced onto His head, bleeding after being nailed on the cross and bleeding from being pierced on His side. This is my theory, “the more He bled His precious blood, the more He was loosing His strength and being that He was also exhausted emotionally, physically, mentally carrying all the weight of sin of every man on His back, He still couldn’t die until His hour had come. It’s very clear to us that the life of the flesh is in the blood. For one to live, he or she has to have blood flowing in them. Jesus became what He was not that we might become what we were not.

With that said, the blood that was shed on the cross was for us lost souls bought with the highest price. When the Roman soldier pierced Him, out of His side came water and blood for lost and not only that, I believe the piercing opened away for us to be grafted (connected) in to Him eternally. We can now live, grow, bear fruit, stand, overcome because we are tied (abiding) in Him because without Him we can do nothing. He lost His blood that we may have a blood transfusion, He replaced our blood with the heavy duty blood, the precious blood of the Lamb, the blood that speaks louder than Abel’s blood, the blood that never ceases to loose it’s power. As the song goes, “There is power, wonder working power in the blood of the Lamb”. We have established the fact that the life of the flesh is in the blood. We will continue with talking about the bleeding believer.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Peter 5:6, “Therefore humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due time”

I believe humbling before the people God has chosen above you is part of humbling yourself under the Mighty hand of God. If you cannot submit to the leaders you can see, how will you submit to a leader you can’t see? Moses was a leader people listened because he was God’s messenger. The bible describes him in Numbers 12:3 as the most humble man on the face of the earth. David knew that he was going to be the next king. He was capable of removing Saul from power but he chose to humble himself under Saul’s leadership knowing that in due time God would make him the next king. The biggest mistake he could have made would have been trying to make it happen on his own.

With humility, it’s not about you making it to the top but God helping you make it to the top. And that is why those who are humbled survive being at the top because as they were humble at the bottom, they are also humble at the top. Ask Joseph, Elisha, Timothy, Joshua, Abigail, and Ruth to mention a few. These are men and women who were humble and God exalted them in due season (time). The children of Israel refused to humble themselves and you know what happened to them.

God recognizes those who humble themselves and pardons them. Ahab took away Naboth’s vineyard, Elijah comes and pronounced judgment but he humbled himself, 1Kings 21:28″ And the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying, 29 “See how Ahab has humbled himself before Me? Because he has humbled himself before Me, I will not bring the calamity in his days”. God also hears and blesses those who humble themselves 2Chronicles 7:14, “if My people who are called by My name will humble themselves, and pray and seek My face, and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin and heal their land”. God saves the humble, Job 22:29, “When they cast you down, and you say, “Exaltation will come!’ Then He will save the humble person”, Psalm 149:4, “For the LORD takes pleasure in His people; He will beautify the humble with salvation“

James 4:6, “But He gives more grace. Therefore He says: “God resists the proud, But gives grace to the humble.”[4:6 Proverbs 3:34]. God gives grace, only one condition, to the humble. If we are saved, we are saved by grace and if we were saved by grace, we had to humble ourselves when we saw ourselves in our true state as sinners. Those who are not saved and feel like they are ok are proud people who will not find grace until they have bowed their knees to the cross of Calvary and say, “God be merciful to me a sinner”. Salvation cannot be attained but by humbling, admitting and repenting, Ephesians 2:8, “For it is by grace that you’ve been saved through faith…” Like Hagar who humbled herself, God in due season blessed, saved, kept, provided, sustained her so will He do the same for us. Now that God has revealed to you by situations what you need to work on, will you humble yourself and throw it back into the fire that He may consume it? deal with revealed by humbling yourself. Be blessed. Ev

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 16, “…When she knew that she was pregnant, she began to despise her mistress”(NIV)

Genesis 16:6, “Then Sarai mistreated Hagar; so she fled from her”, Today there are people who quit their jobs, ministries because of mistreatments. At one point they could take it because it was bearable, they hoped and prayed it would get better. Believe me, I have talked to people especially Christians who have been mistreated to the point of thinking of quitting. Lets see if the Lord takes notice of the victims of mistreatment..

Vs 7, “The angel of the Lord found Hagar near a spring in the desert…vs. 8, And he said, “Hagar, servant of Sarai, where have you come from, and where are you going?”. This verse is an encouragement, right in the midst of discouragement, quitting and running a way, an Angel of the Lord visits just at the right time. I don’t know whether she ever had an experience where someone came to her rescue but here comes an Angel. Abram could not defend her, he couldn’t even intervene when his wife Sarai was mistreating Hagar. Don’t you love it when you are going through something that causes you to run away and then here comes the angel and not just any angel but the Angel of God (often identified in the old testament as the pre-incarnate Christ)? The Angel did not refer to Hagar as Abram’s wife, He referred to her as Sarai’s servant in other words, he is reminding her of her days of humble beginnings, what she had missed. Jesus said, Mark 9:35, “…If anyone desires to be first, he shall be last of all and servant of all.” Pride or ego might have come in but just like Jesus said, “be a servant of all“. She was also being reminded of the order of things. Sarai was her leader in this sense.

You would think the angel would say, “wait here I will put in a good word for you or deal with Sarai”, but what did the angel say to her, vs. 9″…”God back to your mistress and SUBMIT to her”.

This is a word that is hard to deal with because it requires humility for I know not anyone who can bend if they are not humble. Hagar was told to RETURN and SUBMIT. Some situations are not meant to be ran away from, you just need to learn to rearrange the order of things. A good reason to trace back the roots that led to the current situation. You do an evaluation to understand the cause. You can try and run a way from it but the key to your release depends on whether you are willing to deal with submission. It is hard to submit when you feel or know you have more than the person you should submit to or more right. Hagar is young, has more attention now and she is expecting a son (highly valued), why should she submit? Her blessing will come from yielding and surrendering to Sarai’s authority. There can be no submission without humility. How can one bow if they are not humbled? As I have said in the past, “HUMILITY IS NOT A SIGN OF WEAKNESS, IT’S STRENGTH UNDER CONTROL”. Jesus humbled Himself and became obedient even unto the death of the cross. Was He weak? of course not, He said, “No man takes my life, I lay it down“, IT’S A CHOICE NOT A CONDITION. He bowed because He was humbled and after it was said and done, He received the crown, dominion and a sit at the right hand of God the Father. The bible says, “God exalted Jesus and gave Him a name above all names that at the mention of the name Jesus, every knee should bow and every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord to the glory of God the Father. In Hagar’s case, her humility would choke life out of her pride and arrogance that was within her. Do you see again that the situation (fire) brought out the viper within? She had an opportunity to through it back into the fire as the Angel of the Lord helped her deal with it and God blessed her more after? To finish. Ev

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Genesis 16, “…When she knew that she was pregnant, she began to despise her mistress”(NIV)

I mentioned the other day how situations can bring out what is within us what we may have never thought was there. In Acts 28:3, while Paul was gathering sticks for fire to keep them warm, a viper came out because of heat, and fastened around on his hands. That is what the situations out of the ordinary do, they are like fire that generates heat causing the vipers inside of us to jump out and fasten on us. Paul saw the viper fastened around his wrist and dealt with the situation, threw it back into the fire to be consumed.

This is the same way the Lord deals with us, at times He allows fire to come that the viper in us may jump out then we have an opportunity to deal with it, throw it back into the fire that viper for Him to consume it. This is where we cast our cares (our shortcomings) to the Lord and we say Lord consume what You have revealed. I don’t know about you but I thank God for some of those situations that reveal the junk in my life I need to deal with. Some situations push it to the surface leaving you with an option to either embrace it or deal with it.

Genesis 16 tells us of a situation that revealed what was inside. Sarai and Hagar might have not known about it but it was always there. Abram (Abraham) is old so is Sarai (Sarah) but they have no child. Sarai has a maid that has been loyal to her all these years, she is beneath her and everything looks ok and peaceful. Sarai comes up with an idea she will later regret and that is to give Abram Hagar to wife so that Sarai would obtain children by her. All attention had always been given to Sarai but with Hagar present as a wife not a maid servant, brought a divided attention. After some time, Hagar conceives and the problem begins. Hagar began to despise Sarai. Remember any person whom you might have helped climb the ladder of success in an area and once they got up there, they began to despise you regarding you as unworthy. Cared less for you and more so tried to frustrate you? Or has someone helped you get up there and you began to despise them, forgot about them, tried to make their lives miserable? It happens and I have seen it so many times even in the Christian circle. Hagar might have not known that the despising spirit was in her until a situation like this brought that viper out. Someone said “Be good to people on your way up the ladder cause you will meet them on your way down“. The bible says, “Do not despise the days of humble beginnings” (paraphrased). Remembering small beginnings should humble you not to despise those who have not made far as you have.

Genesis 16:5, “Then Sarai said to Abram, “You are responsible for the wrong I am suffering. I put my servant in your arms, and now that she knows she is pregnant, she despises me. May the LORD judge between you and me”(NIV). Sarai on the other hand is battling with jealousy because Abram was going to have a son with Hagar. Who would he want to spend more time with Sarai who is old and childless or Hagar who I believe was young and was going to have a baby? That might have been Sarai’s thought, not getting all the attention she used to get and what was harbored inside is revealed through this situation I would call fire. Have you ever helped someone climb the ladder then you had a problem with it later? They were prospering and you were still in the same place they left you? You used to get all the attention, now it has shifted. The thought of it is killing you inside. Sarai began to mistreat Hagar. She may have not known that she had the spirit of mistreatment inside her until a situation arose. Here is another thing that was revealed, Sarai shifting blame to Abram, “You are responsible for the wrong I am suffering“. Instead of taking part of the responsibility of advising, she throws all the blame on Abram. I would blame Abram too cause as the priest of his own home, there are certain decisions that he should have made to avoid all these but I just want to concentrate on these two women. One is despising, the other one is mistreating. Sounds very familiar but I thank God for them. The Lord searches the heart and tries the mind and if there is a root not of Him inside of us, little fire will cause them to jump out and fasten around our lives and that is good, like Paul when it’s revealed, let’s cast them upon the Lord that He may consume them. He is a consuming fire remember that. I will share more. Ev

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 21:1-29, “And he answered, “I have found you, because you have sold yourself to do evil in the sight of the Lord”

Living this life continuously reveals what is inside, you heard me mention this in one of my devotions the other day. The more you live, the more you discover what is in you that is the work of God’s righteousness. You don’t have to live with yourself long before you see undealt with flaws you never thought or imagined to have within you. I was talking to a friend about how people can change. People you never imagined could plan mischief against you are very much available and ready. This is life and if we never learn how to deal with some of these things, we will always live a defeated life trying to fit in with people, trying to please everyone only to find that you can only do so much. You will still find that there are people who don’t like you and your blessing and some change for reasons unknown to us.

Vs 1, “And it came to pass after these things that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard” We have King Ahab who had power and thing? I don’t know what u meant here. He was married to one of the most wicked women that ever lived, Jezebel who had power over him for some unknown reason. She had a way of running his life according to their story. Ahab was the type of king who was not satisfied with what he already had. He wanted to acquire more and more from even the people who did not have much. Naboth was a nobody compared to Ahab and had nothing apart from Vineyard. Vineyard is a plantation of vines producing grapes. Even though Ahab was the king, he was aware of his boundaries of what he could and could not do therefore he requested to purchase Naboth’s land for a price but Naboth refused to sell his land. I am yet to meet someone who says they have acquired enough therefore they don’t need more. People can be driven by jealousy to desire what already belongs to others, hoping that they will step away from it so that they can have it. Pressure can be put on people to abandon what they have simply because the other person does not want them around or want what they already have. begin to make progress and see if everyone will be pleased.

Ahab could not take what did not belong to him by force, this saddened him but then Jezebel, his wife showed up to encourage him to go against his conscious. I am troubled by people who encourage others to do wrong things coating it with good words to make it sound not too bad. Trying to influence others to go against you because they don’t want to see you progress. Vs 7, “Then Jezebel his wife said to him, “You now exercise authority over Israel“, We need to be very careful about who speaks into our lives and encourages us to do certain things, a good reason for discernment. The people who tend to say some of these things are not from the outer circles but the inner circles just like Jezebel. Pushed by pressure to do something was a wrong move. First mistake, Ahab did was to receive wrong advise and he took it.

vs. 8. “And she wrote letters in Ahab’s name, sealed them with his seal, and sent the letters to the elders and the nobles who were dwelling in the city with Naboth“, second mistake, allowing Jezebel to do everything in his name. Though he is not doing them directly, he is involved directly. If I can’t do my dirty work, I will have someone do it for me. If I can’t get what I want, I will show my pity to someone else that they step in and help me get it. vs. 13, “…and the scoundrels witnessed against him, against Naboth, in the presence of people, saying, “Naboth has blasphemed God and the King“, third mistake, lied on Naboth. vs. 13, “…Then they took him outside the city and stoned him with stones, so that he died“, fourth mistake, killed Naboth. Something that started very innocently has escalated to greater evil. What amazes me is that Ahab was watching all these knowing they were wrong yet said nothing because he supported it. After Naboth had been killed, he matches in and takes the vineyard but God had something to say about it.

1Kings 21:20, “And he answered, “I have found you, because you have sold yourself to do evil in the sight of the Lord”. You give the enemy a room, he will want the whole house. Ahab sold himself to do evil through his wife who gave him wrong advise. He yielded to that voice and allowed her to take advantage of the situation. God does not send a message to Jezebel who did all the work why? I believe Ahab had the power to do right and resist evil but he did not. Do you rejoice with those who are blessed or would you rather see them down, lie about them and speak about them to other people? Are you harboring hatred for them or jealousy over what they have and wishing it was yours? would you rejoice if they failed? Who do you allow to speak into your life? are they giving you good advise? Don’t sell yourself to do evil. Be blessed Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 15:5, “…for without Me you can do nothing”

The more I walk with God the more I learn some of the things that pleases Him, things that He values. These things He has mentioned them in His word. We know for sure that He is a jealous God, He will not share His glory with anyone or with any creature. Over and over again He distinguishes Himself from any other being and allows us to see His uniqueness and His connection to us. I have learnt that if God is going to use anyone, he is using that person to make Him look good before men. I will explain what that means.

A man in the bible blesses my heart for he depicts Christ’s position and his position. John the Baptist understood that he had come to prepare the way. When asked if he was the Christ, he responded that he was not. On one occasion he says, “There comes another one who is mightier than I, whom His shoes I’m unworthy to untie, He shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire” paraphrased). This is a man making Christ look good before other people by magnifying the Lord. And when He saw Jesus coming, he said, “Behold the Lamb of God that takes away the sins of the world“. Some of John’s disciples tried to exalt him when they heard that Jesus was baptizing when in the actual sense He only baptized His disciples. John’s disciples were concerned that Jesus was doing what John was suppose to be doing and this was his response, John 3:27, “…A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven”. Christ was operating in His authority and John’s job was to prepare the way for His coming. In my early years of ministry, I was given an opportunity in occasions to prepare the way for the Lord. But as time went by, anything that was suppose to bring glory to God, I took it because I allowed pride and people to exalt me by thanking me. Tempting opportunities came by to glorify myself and I did. It wasn’t long before I realized that what belongs to God if not handled well, He takes it away and places it in someone else who will acknowledge Him. John responded John 3:30, “He must increase, but I must decrease“. This man understood that everything that was happening in his life was to allow Christ to increase while he decreased. 1Peter 5:6, “Humble yourself therefore under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due season“, When John humbled himself, did Christ exalt him in due season? yes He did, Mathew 11:11, “Assuredly, I say to you, among those born of women there has not risen one greater than John the Baptist“

In the last few years that God broke me and molded me, He has taught me so many things about Him looking good before men. The more I have decreased, the more He has increased in my life. The more I have acknowledged what He has done through me, the more He has trusted me with His anointing and revelations. For those who know me, they know that all appreciations that come my way I give back to God for I am just but a vessel. I have preached many times and people were blessed, they thanked me but I directed it back to God. I refuse to take what belongs to God, that is his praises. Exodus 20:3, “You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who takes the name in vain“. This is the third commandment out of the ten. At first I thought this only meant that if you employed the name of the Lord as a curse word then you have taken His name in vain but I would submit that there is more to it than that. Failing to honor and praise His name is taking His name in vain, failing to thank God for what He has done is taking His name in vain and so is failing to point people to Him who has all the answers to their problems. He loves to hear His name given Honor. You fail to even testify for what He has done, is taking His name in vain because God does not just bless us so that we can be blessed, He blesses us so that we can testify before men of His blessings that they in turn may put their trust in God.

Everything that the Lord is doing in each of us to bring glory to His name, you take any of His glory or failing to give glory to His name could mean lifting it off you and placing it in someone else who will do it. When you have humbled yourself to the point where you know that it’s not about you but about Him, nothing will stop you from giving Him glory due to Him. Someone sang a song to the Lord with these words, “Praises looks good on You“. I’m going to make sure that praise looks good on Him, if He uses me, when it’s been said and done and people have been blessed, I will give Him back the glory. There will be people who will thank me for the word, but I will direct that thanksgiving back to Him. If He says in John 15:5, “…for without Me you can do nothing“, this humbles me to know that any and every good thing that I am doing, He is behind it. The book of Esther did not mention the name of the Lord even once but we could see the Lord’s hand in every good thing that happened. I am constantly humbled to the fact He could pick me up and use me, what more can I do but make Him look good before men who are saved and who are not. He is good and always will but I will still make Him look good for praises looks good on Him. Blessings, Evans

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: We Praise Him For Who He Is

content.rendered:
Good morning
Psalm 34:1, ” I will bless the LORD at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth 2 My soul shall make its boast in the LORD; …”

There was a fellowship my parents would go to in the early 90’s, by then I was not saved. This fellowship always sent a team to the missions field to preach the gospel. In happened that one day as the team was coming back from missions, they had an accident and some lives were lost. It was hard with the fact that they had just come from a weekend of victory. In this particular team, there was a gentleman called Simon, his fiancée and his brother. Simon lost both his brother and fiancée people found it hard to go to his hospital bed and break the news to him about the death of his fiancée and brother. But when they gathered courage to break the sad news expecting the news to crush him, he said something that up to day still speaks to my heart. He said, “We don’t praise God for what He does for us (blessings), WE PRAISE HIM FOR WHO HE IS“. Is this something or what? Let me repeat it, We don’t praise God for what He does for us (blessings), WE PRAISE HIM FOR WHO HE IS“. Our primary reason for praising God is for who He is.

I came across a song yesterday, the lyrics had the many blessings the Lord had done for the song writer then he concludes with this line, “that is the reason I praise Him”, does this mean that if the blessings of the Lord were missing, there would be no praise?, David opens Psalm 34:1, with a declaration, “I will bless the Lord at ALL times, His Praise SHALL continually be in my mouth“, if you know the story of David, David had one of the most hard times in life as a shepherd boy, as a king without a throne and as a king with a throne. You would expect David to only speak those words with all going well for him but that is not the case. When He spoke this Psalm, it was a time David pretended madness before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he departed. Right in the midst of it all he made a declaration to bless the Lord at all times in every situation and persuaded himself to continually praise in his mouth.

It’s easy to want to curse God than bless God in bad times. When we learn the main reason we praise God, we can pick ourselves up even in tough times and bless the Lord anyway for it’s not about us but about Him. Everything happens to His glory whether we believe it or not. Of course no one wants to go through bad times (I would a void it if I can) but can I stand to bless Him anyway?

To strengthen his attitude, he says “My soul shall make its boast in the Lord…”, this makes the devil so mad and confused because he is expecting us to be broken and miserable and perhaps curse God, instead, we brag in and on the Lord. Job was presented with the opportunity to curse God in his hard times but he would not Job 1:21, “And he said: “ Naked I came from my mother’s womb, And naked shall I return there. The LORD gave, and the LORD has taken away; Blessed be the name of the LORD.”

One thing I believe these men Simon, David, and Job would not speak these boldly by themselves, the moment they declared to speak those words of praise, is the same moment God gave them grace and strength to endure and brought them out of their situations. Psalm 34:19, says, “Many are the afflictions of the righteous, But the LORD delivers him out of them all”.

Lord help us to praise You for Who You are.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 5:6, “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, For they shall be filled”

When I step out to witness to the lost, I usually learn a thing or two about the lost. One of the things I have learnt in my continuous encounter with the unsaved is that 99% of the ones I have talked to are not searching. They are comfortable where they are (sinful life) and they hope God will weigh their good and bad, and if they are good is many they tell me, God will overlook their bad and let them into heaven. If we as soundly saved Christians wait till they come to church to hear the gospel before they get saved, very few will and many will continue to have false assurance.

Acts 16, Paul and Silas were jailed, at midnight as they were praying and singing praises and worship to God, 26 Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened and everyone’s chains were loosed”. The keeper of the prison waking up from his sleep and seeing the doors opened and the prisoners missing, he almost killed himself but then Paul and Silas appeared to show him that they did not escape. When the keeper of the prison saw this he fell down trembling before Paul and Silas and said, “sirs, what must I do to be saved?”

How many of the unsaved do you ever hear cry out, “what must I do to be saved” when they are comfortable where they are?. The bible says in Matthew 5:6, “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness For they shall be filled” and how many of the unsaved do you hear hunger and thirst for righteousness? By righteousness I mean the hunger to be made right. It’s the righteousness of God through Christ that saves. We will enter into heaven not because we are good guys but because we are bad guys who Christ has made right by His righteousness. And those who don’t think they are hungry will not thirst to be filled.

If the unsaved are not hungering to be made right, what will create that hunger and thirst like the one the prison keeper had when he said, “sirs, what must I do to be saved? The key is in Matthew 5:13, where Jesus said, “You are the salt of the earth; …? ”

We are the salt of the earth Jesus says, but what does that mean? Salt does a lot of things and one of the things salt does is that, IT CREATES THIRST. When we share with the lost about sin, judgment, God’s righteousness, His holiness, hell, heaven, all we are doing is sharing God’s word that creates hunger and thirst and the more we share the more they become thirsty. The word drives away false hope leaving them hungry and thirsty for righteousness with an out loud cry, “then what must I do to be filled (saved)” and like Jesus in John 4, give water of salvation that satisfies the thirst the law demands (righteousness) and the unsaved never thirst again to be made right because the thirst has been satisfied through the righteousness of God.

As salt, we must go out to the highway and the byways and speak to the lost, give them something that will cause them to hunger and thirst for righteousness where they cry, “what then must I do to be saved”, then give them God’s means of salvation, Jesus Christ. I have seen that they are not coming, so I am going to them because Jesus said so.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Ruth 1:1-22, “Then they lifted up their voices and wept again; and Orpah kissed her mother-in-law, but Ruth clung to her”

Sometime back my pastor talked about making Godly decisions. Decisions that will not only affect you today but for many days, months and even years to come. We have talked about the same with the life of Ruth and Naomi making decisions to change locations when there appears to be no light at the end of the tunnel.

Ruth 1:18, “When she saw that she was determined to go with her (Naomi), she stopped speaking to her. vs. 19, “Now the two of them went until they came to Bethlehem…” I want us to see something from this story. Naomi went to Moab a land where she couldn’t fit in and Ruth is now heading to a land where she does fit in. Both of them cannot go back to the past for they can’t fit in it anymore. Coming to the present, at one time they could fit in but with the new developments, they don’t fit in their present situation. They embark on a journey to find a place to fit it in. They have been told that Bethlehem has been remembered by God and God has graciously provided for His people but the question is, will these two women fit in? They journey to a blessed land, a land visited by God. That is definitely making a Godly decision for God is our only source and refuge.

Naomi is like the prodigal daughter who left the home with so much and now she is coming back empty handed, she doesn’t even want to be called the pleasant one anymore the way her name suggests. All she wants is to be called Mara which means the Almighty has dealt very bitterly with me. She is looking at herself as a failure but her and Ruth were welcomed and embraced regardless of where they had been. People did not care about her history, they cared about her for who she is and has always been. Even through all the afflictions, later you will hear of how she maintained her integrity. Through her life style, she builds another life by the name of Ruth who in turn is spoken highly of for she had one of the best characters anyone could ever admire. Like the prodigal son, Naomi comes in at the right time and her long time friends and relatives are ready to welcome her back.

Orpah cared much about what could benefit her rather than how they could team together and progress. Many have friends when they have everything together, a true friend will stick by your side when you need them the most, during trying times. When the going became tough, she abandoned the other two and went back to where she came from while these other two women moved to new dimensions.

Something about Ruth, she was compassionate, she took to heart what her mother in law taught. The future may have not been promising but she stuck by Naomi for comfort, for strength and for encouragement. Friendship has no boundaries, no age barriers, no timing. It has everything to do with commitment and investment. A friend to fight with, a friend to tell about what you are dealing with, a friend’s shoulder to cry on, a friend to encourage and let you know it will be alright, a friend to go an extra mile.

Through Ruth’s stand, Naomi’s later days may have not been miserable because she had a friend who stuck by her through thick and thin.

Thanks
Evans

She is looking at herself as a failure but her and Ruth were welcomed and embraced regardless of where they had been. People did not care about her history, they cared about her for who she is and has always been. Even through all the afflictions, later you will hear of how she maintained her integrity. Through her life style, she builds another life by the name of Ruth who in turn is spoken highly of for she had one of the best characters anyone could ever admire. Like the prodigal son, Naomi comes in at the right time and her long time friends and relatives are ready to welcome her back.

Orpah cared much about what could benefit her rather than how they could team together and progress. Many have friends when they have everything together, a true friend will stick by your side when you need them the most, during trying times. When the going became tough, she abandoned the other two and went back to where she came from while these other two women moved to new dimensions.

Something about Ruth, she was compassionate, she took to heart what her mother in law taught. The future may have not been promising but she stuck by Naomi for comfort, for strength and for encouragement. Friendship has no boundaries, no age barriers, no timing. It has everything to do with commitment and investment. A friend to fight with, a friend to tell about what you are dealing with, a friend’s shoulder to cry on, a friend to encourage and let you know it will be alright, a friend to go an extra mile.

Through Ruth’s stand, Naomi’s later days may have not been miserable because she had a friend who stuck by her through thick and thin.

Thanks
Evans
